2020 |access-date=15 January 2020}}</ref> With a production budget of US$300 million, the six-episode first season ranks as one of the most-expensive television shows.<ref>{{cite news |last=Armstrong |first=Stephen |title=Why did Amazon pay $300 million for five hours of Richard Madden? |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/0/citadel-amazon-prime-most-expensive-tv-shows/#:~:text=Why%20did%20Amazon%20pay%20%24300,most%20expensive%20show%20ever%20made. |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=27 April 2023 |access-date=28 April 2023}}</ref> It marked the first time in her career when she received equal pay with her male co-star.<ref>{{cite web |last=Agarwal |first=Bhavna |title=Priyanka Chopra playing a lead in Russo Brothers' Citadel is important. 5 Reasons why|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/binge-watch/story/priyanka-chopra-playing-a-lead-in-russo-brothers-citadel-is-important-5-reasons-why-2341084-2023-03-01#:~:text=2.,am%20finally%20doing%20lead%20parts. |work=India Today |date=1 March 2023 |access-date=28 April 2023}}</ref> She performed many of her own stunts, and suffered a permanent scar from an injury on her eyebrow.<ref>{{cite news |last=Malkin |first=Mark |title='Citadel' Star Priyanka Chopra Jonas Reveals On-Set Injury That Gave Her a 'Cool Scar and Good Story to Tell' |url=https://variety.com/2023/scene/events/citadel-priyanka-chopra-jonas-richard-madden-injuries-1235595197/ |work=Variety |date=26 April 2023 |access-date=28 April 2023}}</ref> Critics had mixed opinions on the series,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/tv/citadel/s01 |title=Citadel (2023) |website=Rotten Tomatoes |access-date=28 April 2023}}</ref> but Jasper Rees of ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' was particularly impressed by Chopra Jonas' potential as a female [[James Bond (literary character)|James Bond]], finding her "flirty and funny and hard as a bag of nine-inch nails".<ref>{{cite news |last=Rees |first=Jasper |title=Citadel, review: Amazon have a pricey Bond audition tape – and it's not just Richard Madden's |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/2023/04/27/citadel-amazon-prime-video-review-richard-madden-bond/ |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=27 April 2023 |access-date=28 April 2023}}</ref> She then led the romantic comedy ''[[Love Again (2023 film)|Love Again]]'', opposite [[Sam Heughan]] and [[Celine Dion]], which was panned by critics.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Remley |first1=Hilary |title=Sam Heughan & Priyanka Chopra Jonas Rom-Com ''Love Again'' Sets New Release Date |url=https://collider.com/sam-heughan-priyanka-chopra-jonas-love-again-image-release-date/ |website=Collider |date=2 November 2022|access-date=11 November 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Love Again (2023) |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/love_again_2023 |website=Rotten Tomatoes |date=5 May 2023 |access-date=6 May 2023}}</ref>

Chopra starred alongside [[John Cena]] and [[Idris Elba]] in the action film ''[[Heads of State (film)|Heads of State]],'' which released on [[Amazon Prime Video]] on July 2, 2025.<ref>{{cite web |last=Grobar |first=Matt |date=April 23, 2025 |title=John Cena & Idris Elba Confront Global Conspiracy As 'Heads Of State' In First Trailer For Amazon MGM Action Comedy |url=https://deadline.com/video/heads-of-state-trailer-john-cena-idris-elba/ |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}}</ref> She is now set to appear alongside [[Karl Urban]] in the action film ''[[The Bluff (upcoming film)|The Bluff]]''.<ref>{{cite web |last1=D'Alessandro |first1=Anthony |title=Priyanka Chopra Jonas To Star Opposite John Cena & Idris Elba In Amazon Studios' Action Pic 'Heads Of State' |url=https://deadline.com/2023/04/priyanka-chopra-jonas-john-cena-idris-elba-amazon-studios-heads-of-state-1235318701/ |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=5 April 2023|access-date=11 May 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url= https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-hollywood-film-the-bluff-russo-brothers-zoe-saldana-9124993/lite/|work=Indian Express|access-date=1 March 2024|date=24 January 2024|title= Priyanka Chopra's next Hollywood film The Bluff to be produced by the Russo Brothers, casting call reveals she has replaced Zoe Saldana}}</ref> She will also star in filmmaker [[S. S. Rajamouli]]'s ''Varanasi'' opposite [[Mahesh Babu]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-25 |title=Priyanka Chopra 'finally' drops a hint about her next Indian film on SS Rajamouli's post |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/telugu/priyanka-chopra-ss-rajamouli-mahesh-babu-next-film-instagram-video-9798531/lite/ |access-date=2025-03-26 |website=The Indian Express |language=en}}</ref><!--She will play the spiritual guru [[Ma Anand Sheela]] in [[Barry Levinson]]'s ''Sheela'', a film she will produce for [[Amazon Studios]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Mia |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=20 February 2020 |access-date=1 March 2020}}</ref> Chopra has committed to star alongside [[Mindy Kaling]] in a comedy about an Indian-American wedding under [[Universal Pictures]], and will portray the lawyer [[Vanita Gupta]] in [[Seth Gordon]]'s courtroom drama ''Tulia'', based on the 1999 racial injustice case that took place in the [[Tulia, |archive-date=21 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.filmfare.com/news/priyanka-chopra-will-be-seen-in-a-role-of-a-dynamic-lawyer-in-her-next-hollywood-film-23458.html |title=Priyanka |access-date=20 April 2021 |website=Variety |language=en-US}}</ref> She is also set to star in [[Farhan Akhtar]]'s directorial ''Jee Le Zaraa'' alongside [[Katrina Kaif]] and [[Alia Bhatt]], which is ''Secret'' ''Daughter,'' opposite [[Sienna Miller]] for [[Amazon Studios]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Fleming |first=Mike Jr. |date=21 March 2022 |title=Amazon Acquires 'Secret Daughter' Package; Anthony |access-date=3 February 2022 |website=DNA India |language=en}}</ref> -->

== Music career ==
Chopra's main vocal influence was her father, who helped develop her interest in singing.<ref name="Rediff1">{{cite web |title=Priyanka: I never thought I could sing |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-interview-with-priyanka-chopra-in-my-city/20120914.htm?print=true |work=Rediff.com |access-date=6 January 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508231400/http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-interview-with-priyanka-chopra-in-my-city/20120914.htm?print=true |archive-date=8 May 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Berlin 2012: Priyanka Chopra Talks About Movies Transcending Cultural and Language Barriers (Q&A) |url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/news/berlin-2012-priyanka-chopra-talks-291369 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |author=Bhushan, Nyay |date=15 February 2012 |access-date=5 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120830114759/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/berlin-2012-priyanka-chopra-talks-291369 |archive-date=30 August 2012}}</ref> She used her vocal talent early in her pageantry career.<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra's Foray into Music with Lady Gaga's Management |url=http://divanee.com/2011/08/11/priyanka-chopras-foray-into-music-with-lady-gaga%E2%80%99s-management/ |author=Tabani, Saniya |work=[[Divanee Magazine]] |date=11 August 2011 |access-date=31 August 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120903012220/http://divanee.com/2011/08/11/priyanka-chopras-foray-into-music-with-lady-gaga%E2%80%99s-management/ |archive-date=3 September 2012}}</ref> Her first recording, the song "Ullathai Killathe" in the Tamil film ''[[Thamizhan]]'' (2002), was made at the urging of her director and co-star, Vijay (who had noticed her singing on the set).<ref>{{cite news |title=Eyecatchers&nbsp;— She's Getting Vocal |url=http://archives.digitaltoday.in/indiatoday/20020128/eyecathers.html |work=India Today |publisher=Digital Today |date=28 January 2002 |access-date=16 September 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130725150804/http://archives.digitaltoday.in/indiatoday/20020128/eyecathers.html |archive-date=25 July 2013}}</ref> She declined to sing [[playback singer|playback]] for "Tinka Tinka" in her film ''Karam'' (2005), preferring to concentrate on her acting career, but later sang the song live on the television programme ''[[Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Hindi|Sa Re Ga Ma Pa]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka sings live on TV! |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tv-/Priyanka-sings-live-on-TV-/articleshow/6612768.cms |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510085351/http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-09-24/tv/28237147_1_playback-piggy-chops-priyanka-chopra |url-status=live |archive-date=10 May 2013 |date=24 September 2010 |work=[[The Times of India]] |access-date=4 April 2011}}</ref> Chopra recorded an unreleased song for ''Bluffmaster!'' (2005).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/the-reluctant-singer/1022671/ |title=The Reluctant Singer |author=Chattopadhyay, Pallavi |work=The Indian Express |date=27 October 2012 |access-date=9 December 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121030022528/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/the-reluctant-singer/1022671 |archive-date=30 October 2012}}</ref> In August 2011, [[Universal Music Group]] signed Chopra to a worldwide recording agreement with [[DesiHits]]. The deal indicated that her first studio album would be released by [[Interscope Records]] in North America and by [[Island Records]] elsewhere.<ref name=HR1>{{cite news |title=Universal Music Group Signs Bollywood Star Priyanka Chopra to Global Deal |url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/news/universal-music-group-signs-bollywood-219569 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |author=Bhushan, Nyay |date=5 August 2011 |access-date=31 August 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120430141501/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/universal-music-group-signs-bollywood-219569 |archive-date=30 April 2012}}</ref>

[[File:Priyanka Chopra Promoting In My City.jpg|thumb|upright|Chopra promoting her song ''In My City''|alt=Priyanka Chopra in 2012]]
In July 2012, Chopra became the first Bollywood star signed by [[Creative Artists Agency]], an entertainment and sports agency based in Los Angeles.<ref>{{cite news |title=CAA Signs Its First Bollywood Star |url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/news/bollywood-actress-priyanka-chopra-signed-caa-287524 |author=Bhushan, Nyay |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=2 July 2012 |access-date=20 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114044716/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/bollywood-actress-priyanka-chopra-signed-caa-287524 |archive-date=14 November 2012}}</ref> The album was produced by [[RedOne]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Bollywood Star Priyanka Chopra in the Studio With RedOne |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/bollywood/news/a392157/bollywood-star-priyanka-chopra-in-the-studio-with-redone.html |work=[[Digital Spy]] |author=Baker, Steven |date=7 July 2012 |access-date=30 November 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121024115148/http://www.digitalspy.com/bollywood/news/a392157/bollywood-star-priyanka-chopra-in-the-studio-with-redone.html |archive-date=24 October 2012}}</ref><ref name="latimes">{{cite news |url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/music/la-xpm-2012-nov-20-la-et-ms-1120-bollywood-pop-20121120-story.html |title=Bollywood's Priyanka Chopra as pioneering pop act in U.S. |last=Kennedy |first=Gerrick D. |date=20 November 2012 |access-date=7 December 2012 |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130108120827/http://articles.latimes.com/2012/nov/20/entertainment/la-et-ms-1120-bollywood-pop-20121120 |archive-date=8 January 2013}}</ref> Her first single, "[[In My City]]", debuted in the US on 13 September 2012 in a TV spot for the [[NFL Network]]'s ''[[Thursday Night Football]]'';<ref name=rel>{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Music/Priyanka-Chopra-to-release-debut-song-for-Indian-fans-first/Article1-926437.aspx |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120910212012/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Music/Priyanka-Chopra-to-release-debut-song-for-Indian-fans-first/Article1-926437.aspx |archive-date=10 September 2012 |title=Priyanka Chopra to release debut song for Indian fans first |work=Hindustan Times |author=Singh, Prashant |date=8 September 2012 |url-status=dead |access-date=14 September 2012}}</ref> a shortened version of the song was used to open each show of the season. "In My City" features rapper [[will.i.am]]; according to Chopra, a co-writer,<ref name="latimes" /> the song was inspired by her unsettled childhood and her journey from a small-town girl to a celebrity.<ref name=inspire /> The song received mixed reviews from critics, and was a commercial success in India; it sold more than 130,000&nbsp;copies in its first week, topped the Hindi pop chart and was certified [[list of music recording certifications|triple platinum]].<ref name="latimes" /><ref name=DS2>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra releases video for will.i.am duet 'In My City' |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/bollywood/news/a454543/priyanka-chopra-releases-video-for-william-duet-in-my-city.html |website=[[Digital Spy]] |author=Joshi, Priya |date=30 January 2013 |access-date=27 February 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130202092327/http://www.digitalspy.com/bollywood/news/a454543/priyanka-chopra-releases-video-for-william-duet-in-my-city.html |archive-date=2 February 2013}}</ref> In the United States the single was unsuccessful, with 5,000&nbsp;digital downloads in its first week according to [[Nielsen SoundScan]], and did not receive radio play.<ref name="latimes" /> In October 2012, the single won her the Best International Debut award at the [[People's Choice Awards India]].<ref name=pca>{{cite web |title=Gorgeous Chopra Sisters: Priyanka And Parineeti Perform At People's Choice Awards |url=http://businessofcinema.com/news/gorgeous-chopra-sisters-priyanka-and-parineeti-perform-at-peoples-choice-awards/53236 |publisher=Business of Cinema |date=31 October 2012 |access-date=28 December 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121108043736/http://businessofcinema.com/news/gorgeous-chopra-sisters-priyanka-and-parineeti-perform-at-peoples-choice-awards/53236 |archive-date=8 November 2012}}</ref> In December 2012, she received three nominations: Best Female Artist, Best Song and Best Video (for "In My City") at the [[World Music Awards]].<ref>World Music Awards nominations for Priyanka Chopra:
* Female Artist:{{cite web |url=http://www.worldmusicawards.com/?page_id=17#!worlds-best-female-artist/c9px |title=World's Best Female Artist |publisher=[[World Music Awards]] |access-date=10 December 2012 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6CkFuJhMV?url=http://www.worldmusicawards.com/?page_id=17 |archive-date=8 December 2012 |url-status=dead}}
* Song:{{cite web |url=http://www.worldmusicawards.com/?page_id=26#!worlds-best-song/ct9a |title=World's Best Song |publisher=World Music Awards |access-date=10 December 2012 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6CkGSzOqX?url=http://www.worldmusicawards.com/?page_id=26 |archive-date=8 December 2012 |url-status=dead}}
* Video:{{cite web |url=http://www.worldmusicawards.com/#!worlds-best-video/cdjm |title=World's Best Video |publisher=World Music Awards |access-date=10 December 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20121216155313/http://www.worldmusicawards.com/ |archive-date=16 December 2012}}</ref> Chopra was also featured on "Erase", an [[electronic dance music|EDM]] song produced by the American DJ and producer duo [[The Chainsmokers]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/%22priyanka-chopra-features-in-chainsmokers-album%22/1034894/ |title=Priyanka Chopra features in 'Chainsmokers' album |work=The Indian Express |date=22 November 2012 |access-date=27 November 2012}}</ref><ref name="iTunes release">{{cite web |url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/erase-feat-priyanka-chopra-single/1444879383 |title=Erase ft. Priyanka Chopra&nbsp;– Single by The Chainsmokers |date=January 2012 |publisher=[[iTunes Store]] |access-date=5 December 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121206082842/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/erase-feat.-priyanka-chopra/id580669727 |archive-date=6 December 2012}}</ref>

In July 2013, Chopra released her second single "[[Exotic (Priyanka Chopra song)|Exotic]]" featuring American rapper [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]], along with its music video.<ref name=exotic>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra Makes Music Magic With Pitbull, RedOne on 'Exotic' |url=http://ryanseacrest.com/2013/06/21/priyanka-chopra-makes-music-magic-with-pitbull-redone-on-exotic/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130624233708/http://ryanseacrest.com/2013/06/21/priyanka-chopra-makes-music-magic-with-pitbull-redone-on-exotic/ |archive-date=24 June 2013 |publisher=[[On Air with Ryan Seacrest (radio)|On Air with Ryan Seacrest]] |author=Perricone, Kathleen |access-date=25 June 2013 |date=21 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/priyanka-chopras-second-single-exotic-is-topping-charts/1140108/ |title=Priyanka Chopra's second single Exotic is topping charts |work=The Indian Express |author=Goyal, Divya |date=10 July 2013 |access-date=10 July 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130714131841/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/priyanka-chopras-second-single-exotic-is-topping-charts/1140108 |archive-date=14 July 2013}}</ref> "Exotic" debuted at number 16 on the [[Dance/Electronic Songs|''Billboard'' Dance/Electronic Songs]] and number&nbsp;11 on the [[Dance/Electronic Digital Songs]] chart on 27 July 2013 issue.<ref name=DanceDigital>{{cite magazine |title=Dance/Electronic Digital Songs : July 27, 2013 |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/2013-07-27/dance-electronic-digital-songs |magazine=Billboard |access-date=24 July 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130815024206/http://www.billboard.com/charts/2013-07-27/dance-electronic-digital-songs |archive-date=15 August 2013}}</ref> The single also entered at number 74 on the [[Canadian Hot 100]] chart. "Exotic" debuted at number 44 on the [[Hot Dance Club Songs|''Billboard'' Hot Dance Club Songs]] chart and peaked at number 12.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5638240/chart-highlights-luke-bryan-scores-his-highest-debut-ever-on-country-airplay |title=Chart Highlights: Luke Bryan Scores His Highest Debut Ever on Country Airplay Chart |author=Caulfield, Keith |magazine=Billboard |date=5 August 2013 |access-date=28 October 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131024063027/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5638240/chart-highlights-luke-bryan-scores-his-highest-debut-ever-on-country-airplay |archive-date=24 October 2013}}</ref> Her third single, a cover of [[Bonnie Raitt]]'s "[[I Can't Make You Love Me#Priyanka Chopra version|I Can't Make You Love Me]]" was released in April 2014.<ref>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra Has Her Heart Broken In I Can't Make You Love Me Video |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/music/priyanka-chopra-has-her-heart-broken-in-i-can-t-make-you-love-me-video-516892 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140501164948/http://movies.ndtv.com/music/priyanka-chopra-has-her-heart-broken-in-i-can-t-make-you-love-me-video-516892 |archive-date=1 May 2014 |author=Dhingra, Manisha |publisher=NDTV |date=1 May 2014 |access-date=5 May 2014}}</ref> The song peaked at number 28 on the ''Billboard'' Hot Dance/Electronic Songs chart.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/biz/search/charts?f%5B0%5D=ts_chart_artistname%3A%2Apriyanka%20chopra%2A |title=Artist Charts Search: Priyanka Chopra |work=Billboard Chart Search |access-date=9 March 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6PV56TSnt?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/search/charts?f%5B0%5D=ts_chart_artistname%3A%2Apriyanka%20chopra%2A&f%5B1%5D=ss_bb_type%3Achart_item&type=2&artist=priyanka%20chopra |archive-date=11 May 2014}}</ref>

Chopra's first song as a playback singer in Bollywood was "Chaoro", a [[lullaby]] from ''Mary Kom'' (2014).<ref>{{cite news |title=When Priyanka Chopra sang a lullaby |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/When-Priyanka-Chopra-sang-a-lullaby/articleshow/41667703.cms |author=Bhattacharya, Roshmila |author-link=Roshmila Bhattacharya |work=The Times of India |date=4 September 2014 |access-date=10 October 2014 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140908171947/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/When-Priyanka-Chopra-sang-a-lullaby/articleshow/41667703.cms |archive-date=8 September 2014}}</ref> In 2015, she sang the title song, a duet with Farhan Akhtar, for ''[[Dil Dhadakne Do]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=Dil Dhadakne Do Title Song Out Today; Singer Priyanka Chopra Counts Down |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/dil-dhadakne-do-title-song-out-today-singer-priyanka-chopra-counts-down-757433 |author=Blaggan, Ishita |publisher=NDTV |date=23 April 2015 |access-date=18 November 2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119061738/http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/dil-dhadakne-do-title-song-out-today-singer-priyanka-chopra-counts-down-757433 |archive-date=19 November 2016}}</ref> She recorded a promotional song for ''Ventilator'' (2016), making her [[Marathi language]] playback singing debut with "Baba".<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra's Song 'Baba' for the Film 'Ventilator' Is a Beautiful Tribute to Fathers |url=http://www.news18.com/news/movies/priyanka-chopras-song-baba-for-the-film-ventilator-is-a-beautiful-tribute-to-fathers-1307831.html |publisher=News18 |date=3 November 2016 |access-date=18 November 2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119062015/http://www.news18.com/news/movies/priyanka-chopras-song-baba-for-the-film-ventilator-is-a-beautiful-tribute-to-fathers-1307831.html |archive-date=19 November 2016}}</ref> In 2017, Chopra collaborated with the Australian DJ [[Will Sparks]] for "Young and Free", an EDM song which she also wrote.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Will Sparks Teams Up With Priyanka Chopra on 'Young and Free': Exclusive |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/dance/7897984/will-sparks-priyanka-chopra-young-and-free |author=Bein, Kat |magazine=Billboard |date=11 August 2017 |access-date=12 August 2017 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170814062051/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/dance/7897984/will-sparks-priyanka-chopra-young-and-free |archive-date=14 August 2017}}</ref> Chopra later said that her music career "was not living up to my standards" and that it would have been "futile" to have kept pursuing it.<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra on her music career: 'It was futile to spend more time there' |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-on-her-music-career-it-was-futile-to-spend-more-time-there-101631938526210.html |work=Hindustan Times |date=18 September 2021|access-date=20 April 2023}}</ref>

== Philanthropy ==
Chopra supports various causes through her foundation "The Priyanka Chopra Foundation for Health and Education", which works towards providing support to unprivileged children across the country in the areas of Education and Health.<ref>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra named Campaign Ambassador for 'NDTV-Vedanta Our Girls Our Pride' |url=http://www.ndtv.com/india-news/priyanka-chopra-named-campaign-ambassador-for-ndtv-vedanta-our-girls-our-pride-532110 |publisher=NDTV |date=19 August 2013 |access-date=2 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151007032953/http://www.ndtv.com/india-news/priyanka-chopra-named-campaign-ambassador-for-ndtv-vedanta-our-girls-our-pride-532110 |archive-date=7 October 2015}}</ref> She donates ten percent of her earnings to fund the foundation's operations, and pays for educational and medical expenses for seventy children in India, fifty among whom are girls.<ref>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra's Secret Triumph: How the Quantico Star Is Helping Kids Go to School |url=http://www.glamour.com/story/quantico-star-priyanka-chopra-on-education |author=Hayasaki, Erika |work=[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]] |date=17 March 2016 |access-date=23 April 2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423000137/http://www.glamour.com/story/quantico-star-priyanka-chopra-on-education |archive-date=23 April 2016}}</ref> She speaks out on women's issues: against female [[infanticide]] and [[feticide|foeticide]], and in support of [[Female education|education for girls]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Educating the girl child is most important |url=http://madeinatlant.powweb.com/priyanka_chopra/interview2.htm |publisher=Atlantis International |access-date=2 December 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513100310/http://madeinatlant.powweb.com/priyanka_chopra/interview2.htm |archive-date=13 May 2013}}</ref> A believer in [[feminism]], Chopra has been vocal about [[women's rights]], [[gender equality]], and [[gender pay gap]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka cries gender inequality, wants more pay for actresses |url=http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/priyanka-cries-gender-inequality-wants-more-pay-for-actresses-1563635.html |work=Firstpost |date=10 June 2014 |access-date=2 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140713202735/http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/priyanka-cries-gender-inequality-wants-more-pay-for-actresses-1563635.html |archive-date=13 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=I am an extremely proud feminist: Priyanka Chopra |url=http://www.ibnlive.com/news/movies/i-am-an-extremely-proud-feminist-priyanka-chopra-1180609.html |author=Press Trust of India |work=IBNLive |publisher=CNN-IBN |date=23 December 2015 |access-date=2 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160202180950/http://www.ibnlive.com/news/movies/i-am-an-extremely-proud-feminist-priyanka-chopra-1180609.html |archive-date=2 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Need a re-look into women's rights in the country: Priyanka Chopra |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/need-a-re-look-into-womens-rights-in-the-country-priyanka-chopra-609728 |author=Press Trust of India |publisher=NDTV |date=25 December 2012 |access-date=2 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160202175942/http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/need-a-re-look-into-womens-rights-in-the-country-priyanka-chopra-609728 |archive-date=2 February 2016}}</ref> In 2006, a "day with Chopra" was auctioned on eBay; the proceeds were donated to an NGO, Nanhi Kali, which helps educate girls in India.<ref name=ebay>{{cite press release |title=eBay India unveils the eBay Style Diva 2006 |url=http://pages.ebay.in/community/aboutebay/news/pressreleases/consumer/priyanka_chopra.html |publisher=[[eBay]] |date=10 August 2006 |access-date=13 February 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140202154104/http://pages.ebay.in/community/aboutebay/news/pressreleases/consumer/priyanka_chopra.html |archive-date=2 February 2014}}</ref> She has made appearances in support of other charities, such as the 2005 HELP! Telethon Concert to raise funds for the victims of the [[2004 Indian Ocean earthquake]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1050208/asp/nation/story_4351693.asp |title=Bollywood unites to present caring face |work=The Telegraph |date=8 February 2005 |access-date=13 December 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118103831/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1050208/asp/nation/story_4351693.asp |archive-date=18 January 2012}}</ref>

She has worked with [[UNICEF]] since 2006, recording public-service announcements and participating in media panel discussions promoting children's rights and the education of girls, and also participated in celebrating the 20th anniversary of the Convention on the Rights of the Child.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-234085904.html |title=Bollywood Actress Priyanka Chopra Becomes UNICEF National Ambassador |publisher=State News Service |date=10 August 2013 |access-date=5 April 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509115239/http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-234085904.html |archive-date=9 May 2013 |newspaper=States News Service}}</ref> She was appointed as the national [[UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador]] for Child Rights on 10 August 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.unicef.org/media/media_55497.html |title=Bollywood Actress Priyanka Chopra becomes UNICEF National Ambassador |publisher=[[UNICEF]] |date=10 August 2010 |access-date=5 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131020123305/http://www.unicef.org/media/media_55497.html |archive-date=20 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka for girls' education as UNICEF ambassador |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/priyanka-for-girls-education-as-unicef-ambassador/658577/ |work=The Indian Express |date=10 August 2010 |access-date=5 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121029172110/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/priyanka-for-girls-education-as-unicef-ambassador/658577 |archive-date=29 October 2012}}</ref> UNICEF Representative Karin Hulshof said of the appointment: "She is equally passionate about her work on behalf of children and adolescents. We are proud of the work she has done with us so far on child rights, and, we are thrilled about all what we will be doing together so that no child gets left behind."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P3-2106098691.html |title=Priyanka Chopra becomes UNICEF National Ambassador |work=Hindustan Times |date=10 August 2010 |access-date=5 April 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509105625/http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P3-2106098691.html |archive-date=9 May 2013}}</ref> In 2009, she shot a documentary for the organisation Alert India to increase understanding of [[leprosy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://thediplomat.com/new-emissary/2009/11/10/top-actress-no-2-priyanka-chopra/ |title=Top Actress No. 2&nbsp;– Priyanka Chopra |author=Nakagawa, Ulara |work=[[The Diplomat (magazine)|The Diplomat]] |date=10 November 2009 |access-date=12 February 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509203014/https://thediplomat.com/new-emissary/2009/11/10/top-actress-no-2-priyanka-chopra/ |archive-date=9 May 2013}}</ref> She modelled for designer [[Manish Malhotra]] and [[Shaina NC]]'s charity fashion show to raise funds for the Cancer Patients Aid Association NGO.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mumbai fashion show spreads awareness about cancer |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/bollywood/story/mumbai-fashion-show-spreads-awareness-about-cancer-107916-2012-07-02 |work=India Today |date=3 July 2012 |access-date=28 November 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121016064848/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/mumbai-fashion-show-spreads-awareness-about-cancer/1/203598.html |archive-date=16 October 2012 |url-status=live}}</ref> In 2010 Chopra was one of several celebrities who created promotional messages for Pearls Wave Trust, which campaigns against violence and abuse of women and girls.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-bollywood-celebrities-to-support-pearls-wave-intitiave-on-women-against-violence-1347298 |title=Bollywood celebrities to support Pearls Wave initiative on women against violence |work=Daily News and Analysis |access-date=3 February 2014 |date=13 February 2010 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221030351/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-bollywood-celebrities-to-support-pearls-wave-intitiave-on-women-against-violence-1347298 |archive-date=21 February 2014}}</ref> Chopra also launched the "Save the Girl Child" campaign, which aims to change the attitudes of Indians towards girls.<ref>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra kicks off 'Save Girl Child' campaign |url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/etc/priyanka-chopra-kicks-off-save-girl-child-campaign_612977.html |publisher=Zee News |date=10 March 2012 |access-date=5 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130523162534/http://zeenews.india.com/news/etc/priyanka-chopra-kicks-off-save-girl-child-campaign_612977.html |archive-date=23 May 2013}}</ref> In 2012 Chopra spoke at the launch of Awakening Youth, an anti-addiction programme.<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra at Launch of 'Awakening Youth 2012' (video) |url=http://www.thesundayindian.com/en/videos/774/ |work=The Sunday Indian |access-date=5 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140330004602/http://www.thesundayindian.com/en/videos/774/ |archive-date=30 March 2014}}</ref>

At a public event in 2019, an activist criticised Chopra for a tweet in which she hailed India's military forces while tensions amid Pakistan and India were escalating. The main line of argument was that she was warmongering and that was incompatible with her job as UN Peace Ambassador. Chopra's response at the event was that she is patriotic.<ref name="The New York Times 2019">{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/13/style/priyanka-chopra-beautycon-india-pakistan.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190813225012/https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/13/style/priyanka-chopra-beautycon-india-pakistan.html |archive-date=13 August 2019 |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |title=Priyanka Chopra Came to Talk About Beauty. It Got Political. |date=13 August 2019 |website=The New York Times |access-date=25 August 2019}}</ref><ref name="agencies 2019">{{cite web |url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/aug/13/priyanka-chopra-accused-of-encouraging-nuclear-war-with-pakistan |title=Priyanka Chopra accused of 'encouraging nuclear war' with Pakistan |author=<!--Not stated--> |date=13 August 2019 |website=The Guardian |access-date=25 August 2019}}</ref><ref name="Zakaria 2019">{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/08/13/opinions/priyanka-chopras-blind-patriotism-zakaria/index.html |title=Priyanka Chopra's blind patriotism |last=Zakaria |first=Rafia |date=13 August 2019 |website=CNN |access-date=27 August 2019}}</ref> Pakistan asked for Chopra being sacked from her UN job but UN supported Chopra's right to talk for herself.<ref name="Al Jazeera 2019">{{cite web |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/08/pakistan-asks-remove-priyanka-chopra-goodwill-ambassador-190821081840304.html |title=Pakistan asks UN to remove Priyanka Chopra as goodwill ambassador |date=21 August 2019 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=25 August 2019}}</ref><ref name="Pundir 2019">{{cite web |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/priyanka-chopras-controversial-tweet-during-indo-pak-tensions-finds-un-support/ |title=Priyanka Chopra's Controversial Tweet During Indo-Pak Tensions Finds UN Support |last=Pundir |first=Pallavi |date=23 August 2019 |website=Vice |access-date=25 August 2019}}</ref>

[[File:Priyanka on the ramp for Mijwan fashion show.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Chopra on the ramp for Mijwan charity fashion show in 2012|alt=Priyanka Chopra in 2012]]
Chopra is a supporter of environmental charities and is brand ambassador for [[NDTV]] Greenathon, an initiative to support eco-friendliness and provide [[solar power]] to rural villages without electricity supplies.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hindu.com/mp/2011/06/09/stories/2011060951860400.htm |title=Green agenda |author=Kumar, Anuj |date=9 June 2011 |access-date=28 September 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130813153414/http://www.hindu.com/mp/2011/06/09/stories/2011060951860400.htm |work=[[The Hindu]] |archive-date=13 August 2013}}</ref> She appeared with children in an animated video to support the cause,<ref>{{cite news |title=Greenie Priyanka gets animated |url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2010/feb/110210-Priyanka-Chopra-music-video-Animated-environmental-awareness.htm |author=Joshi, Tushar |work=[[Mid-Day]] |date=11 February 2010 |access-date=13 February 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130615041051/http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2010/feb/110210-Priyanka-Chopra-music-video-Animated-environmental-awareness.htm |archive-date=15 June 2013}}</ref> and removed rubbish from the banks of the [[Yamuna river]] in [[Agra]] to increase awareness of environmental issues.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.internationalreporter.com/News-10936/priyanka-chopra-promotes-greenathon-campaign.html |title=Priyanka Chopra promotes Greenathon campaign |publisher=International Reporter |date=10 April 2012 |access-date=10 April 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120413214651/http://www.internationalreporter.com/News-10936/priyanka-chopra-promotes-greenathon-campaign.html |archive-date=13 April 2012}}</ref> During the third and fourth editions of Greenathon, She adopted up to seven villages to provide with a regular supply of electricity.<ref>{{cite web |title=Greenathon: Bollywood, NDTV light up a 'Billion lives' |url=http://www.sify.com/movies/Greenathon-Bollywood-NDTV-light-up-a-Billion-lives-imagegallery-bollywood-lgirSucdjbg.html?html=5 |website=[[Sify]] |access-date=13 December 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110811082553/http://www.sify.com/movies/Greenathon-Bollywood-NDTV-light-up-a-Billion-lives-imagegallery-bollywood-lgirSucdjbg.html?html=5 |archive-date=11 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=SRK, Priyanka adopt villages |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/srk-priyanka-adopt-villages/story-eI8ZrVTaGzGDlarnazfrYI.html |work=Hindustan Times |date=23 May 2012 |access-date=2 February 2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160222215604/http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/srk-priyanka-adopt-villages/story-eI8ZrVTaGzGDlarnazfrYI.html |archive-date=22 February 2016}}</ref> She adopted a tigress in 2011 and a lioness in 2012 at the [[Ranchi#Tourist attractions|Birsa biological park]], paying for both animals upkeep for a year.<ref>{{cite news |title=After tigress, Priyanka adopts lioness Sundari |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ranchi/After-tigress-Priyanka-adopts-lioness-Sundari/articleshow/13717411.cms |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510065204/http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-02/ranchi/31983339_1_animal-adoption-zoo-authorities-lioness |url-status=live |archive-date=10 May 2013 |date=2 June 2012 |work=[[The Times of India]] |access-date=5 September 2012}}</ref> To promote organ donation, Chopra pledged to donate her own organs after death and was co-keynote speaker at the [[University of Pittsburgh Medical Center]]'s Bollywood-themed 20th-anniversary celebration of its liver-transplant programme in 2012.<ref>{{cite news |title=URMC celebrates 20 years of liver transplants Bollywood star Priyanka Chopra to grace gala banquet as keynote speaker |url=http://www.indiatribune.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=9610:urmc-celebrates-20-years-of-liver-transplants-bollywood-star-priyanka-chopra-to-grace-gala-banquet-as-keynote-speaker&catid=25:community&Itemid=457 |work=[[India Tribune]] |access-date=9 October 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407051527/http://www.indiatribune.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=9610%3Aurmc-celebrates-20-years-of-liver-transplants-bollywood-star-priyanka-chopra-to-grace-gala-banquet-as-keynote-speaker&catid=25%3Acommunity&Itemid=457 |archive-date=7 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka pledges to donate her organs |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Priyanka-pledges-to-donate-her-organs/etarticleshow/16332193.cms |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121101100506/http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-09-10/news-interviews/33736488_1_organ-donation-priyanka-chopra-pee-cee |url-status=live |archive-date=1 November 2012 |author=Kadam, Prachi |date=10 September 2012 |work=[[The Times of India]] |access-date=21 September 2012}}</ref>

She donated {{INRConvert|5|m}} to [[Nanavati hospital]] to build a cancer ward. The ward, which is named after her late father, was inaugurated by her in 2013.<ref>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra donates Rs 50 lakh for cancer ward |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Priyanka-Chopra-Bollywood-CancerDr-Ashok-Chopra/articleshow/24550457.cms? |work=The Times of India |date=22 October 2013 |access-date=2 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160202080551/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Priyanka-Chopra-Bollywood-CancerDr-Ashok-Chopra/articleshow/24550457.cms |archive-date=2 February 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> The same year, she provided voice-over in English and Hindi for the documentary film ''[[Girl Rising (film)|Girl Rising]]'' for the [[Girl Rising|organisation of the same name]].<ref name=gr>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra joins Anne Hathaway and Selena Gomez in a documentary |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news-interviews/Priyanka-Chopra-joins-Anne-Hathaway-and-Selena-Gomez-in-a-documentary/articleshow/29883744.cms |author=Thakkar, Mehul S |date=5 February 2014 |access-date=3 April 2014 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140304080248/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news-interviews/Priyanka-Chopra-joins-Anne-Hathaway-and-Selena-Gomez-in-a-documentary/articleshow/29883744.cms |archive-date=4 March 2014}}</ref> She was invited as one of the speakers alongside [[Gordon Brown]], [[Steve Wozniak]], [[Bill Clinton]], and [[Charlie Baker]] for the 50th anniversary of the World Leaders Conference at the [[Hynes Convention Center]], Boston. She spoke about [[Women's empowerment|women empowerment]] through education, discussing inequality and the challenges of education for women.<ref>{{cite news |title=EF Education First bash draws Bill Clinton, others |url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/lifestyle/names/2015/02/15/education-anniversary-bash-attracts-bill-clinton-other-leaders/OySWnGuHrRzboIuD5DGmON/story.html |author=Shanahan, Mark |work=[[The Boston Globe]] |date=15 February 2015 |access-date=11 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180711120946/https://www.bostonglobe.com/lifestyle/names/2015/02/15/education-anniversary-bash-attracts-bill-clinton-other-leaders/OySWnGuHrRzboIuD5DGmON/story.html |archive-date=11 July 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra shares stage with Bill Clinton |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-shares-stage-with-bill-clinton/story-8hXuqma5H4pcn3kjpWqALL.html |author=Das, Anirban |work=The Hindustan Times |date=15 February 2015 |access-date=11 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180711185225/https://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-shares-stage-with-bill-clinton/story-8hXuqma5H4pcn3kjpWqALL.html |archive-date=11 July 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref> Chopra also lent her voice to a music video of [[John Lennon]]'s "[[Imagine (John Lennon song)|Imagine]]". The video featuring her along with other singers, including [[Katy Perry]], and [[The Black Eyed Peas]] was created as part of a global campaign by [[UNICEF]] to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the [[Convention on the Rights of the Child]].<ref name="The Indian Express">{{cite web |url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-sings-john-lennons-imagine-for-unicef/ |title=Priyanka Chopra Sings John Lennon's 'Imagine' For UNICEF |date=12 November 2014 |work=The Indian Express |access-date=9 December 2014 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141215014415/http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-sings-john-lennons-imagine-for-unicef/ |archive-date=15 December 2014}}</ref>

Indian prime minister [[Narendra Modi]] selected Chopra as one of his nine nominees called "Navratna" in 2014 for the [[Swachh Bharat Abhiyan]], a national cleanliness campaign by the [[Government of India]].<ref>{{cite web |title='Swachh Bharat': Tendulkar, Priyanka Chopra, Aamir Khan accept PM Modi's 'Clean India' invite |url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2014-10-02/news/54560275_1_clean-india-swachh-bharat-mission-priyanka-chopra |work=The Economic Times |date=2 October 2014 |access-date=2 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150728052006/http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2014-10-02/news/54560275_1_clean-india-swachh-bharat-mission-priyanka-chopra |archive-date=28 July 2015}}</ref> She lent her support to the campaign by working as a [[sanitation worker]] for a day, cleaning and rehabilitating a [[garbage]]-laden neighbourhood in Mumbai, and urged people to maintain the cleanliness.<ref>{{cite web |title=PM Modi lauds Priyanka Chopra's innovative Clean India effort |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/bollywood/story/pm-narendra-modi-lauds-priyanka-chopras-innovative-swachh-bharat-abhiyaan-228426-2014-11-24 |work=India Today |date=24 November 2014 |access-date=2 February 2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150327024832/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/pm-narendra-modi-lauds-priyanka-chopras-innovative-swachh-bharat-abhiyaan/1/403490.html |archive-date=27 March 2015}}</ref>

In 2015, she voiced [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals]] (PETA's) life-size robotic elephant named "Ellie", who visited schools across the United States and Europe to educate kids about elephants and captivity, and to urge people to boycott circuses.<ref>{{cite web |title='Quantico' Star Priyanka Chopra Teams With PETA to Voice Mechanical Elephant |url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/news/quantico-star-priyanka-chopra-teams-836175 |author=Gardner, Chris |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=3 November 2015 |access-date=2 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151224132600/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/quantico-star-priyanka-chopra-teams-836175 |archive-date=24 December 2015}}</ref> Chopra was appointed as the global UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador in December 2016.<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra becomes UNICEF's Global Goodwill Ambassador |url=http://www.deccanherald.com/content/586374/priyanka-chopra-becomes-unicefs-global.html |work=Deccan Herald |date=13 December 2016 |access-date=13 December 2016}}</ref> In 2017, ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' honoured her with the Power of Women award for her philanthropic work with UNICEF and she received the [[Mother Teresa Awards|Mother Teresa Memorial Award for Social Justice]] for her contribution towards social causes.<ref>{{cite web |title=Priyanka Chopra, Octavia Spencer, Michelle Pfeiffer, Patty Jenkins, Kelly Clarkson to Be Honored at Variety's Power of Women |url=https://variety.com/2017/biz/news/variety-power-of-women-los-angeles-2017-1202573581/ |work=Variety |date=26 September 2017 |access-date=1 November 2017 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171031235003/http://variety.com/2017/biz/news/variety-power-of-women-los-angeles-2017-1202573581/ |archive-date=31 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra receives Mother Teresa Memorial award for social justice |url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/bollywood/121217/priyanka-chopra-receives-mother-teresa-memorial-award-for-social-justice.html |work=Deccan Chronicle |date=12 December 2017 |access-date=15 December 2017 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171215055243/https://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/bollywood/121217/priyanka-chopra-receives-mother-teresa-memorial-award-for-social-justice.html |archive-date=15 December 2017}}</ref> Two years later, Chopra was awarded the [[Danny Kaye|Danny Kaye Humanitarian Award]] by UNICEF for her "philanthropic work and dedication towards the welfare of the society" at the UNICEF Snowflake Ball 2019.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.news18.com/news/lifestyle/priyanka-chopra-receives-humanitarian-award-at-unicef-snowflake-ball-2411317.html |title=Priyanka Chopra Receives Humanitarian Award at UNICEF Snowflake Ball |publisher=News18 |date=4 December 2019 |access-date=9 March 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191205140232/https://www.news18.com/news/lifestyle/priyanka-chopra-receives-humanitarian-award-at-unicef-snowflake-ball-2411317.html |archive-date=5 December 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref>

In December 2019, Chopra teamed-up with the [[United Nations Children's Fund]] and the [[Crocs|Crocs Company]] to donate 50,000 pairs of shoes to school children in the Central American country, Belize.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.news18.com/news/lifestyle/priyanka-chopra-joins-footwear-brand-to-donate-50000-pairs-of-shoes-to-school-children-in-belize-2428297.html |title=Priyanka Chopra Joins Footwear Brand to Donate 50,000 Pairs of Shoes to School Children in Belize |publisher=News18 |date=18 December 2019 |access-date=9 March 2020}}</ref>

In late April 2021, due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic in India]], Chopra along with husband [[Nick Jonas|Nick]] opened a fundraiser along with NGO GiveIndia to get donations for oxygen supply, COVID-19 care centers, testing, and vaccination efforts. The fundraiser had achieved USD 400,000 in the first few days.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Evans |first1=Olivia |title=Priyanka Chopra Is Raising Money for India's Covid Crisis |url=https://www.thecut.com/2021/04/priyanka-chopra-is-raising-money-for-indias-covid-crisis.html |access-date=2 May 2021 |work=The Cut |date=30 April 2021}}</ref> Chopra's brother-in-law [[Kevin Jonas]] also urged his followers to help donate to the fundraiser.{{cn|date=September 2025}} By 13 May 2021, the fundraiser had achieved the $1 million landmark and put its newer target at $3 million for COVID-19 relief.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bhowal |first1=Tlasa |title=Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas raise $1 million for Covid relief in India |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/celebrities/story/priyanka-chopra-nick-jonas-raise-1-million-for-covid-relief-in-india-1801994-2021-05-13 |access-date=13 May 2021 |work=India Today |date=13 May 2021}}</ref>

== Other works ==
=== Film production and entrepreneurship ===
Chopra set up her production company [[Purple Pebble Pictures]] with an aim to produce small budget films and introduce and promote new talent in the [[Indian film industry]], particularly [[Cinema of India#Regional cinema|regional Indian films]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra wants to promote new talent |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-priyanka-chopra-wants-to-promote-new-talent-2165696 |work=Daily News and Analysis |author=KBR, UPALA |date=14 January 2016 |access-date=28 April 2016}}</ref> Her first [[Marathi cinema|Marathi film]], the 2016 comedy-drama ''[[Ventilator (2016 film)|Ventilator]]'', was a box office success and went on to win three awards at the [[64th National Film Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/Marathi-Punjabi-films-that-made-a-mark-in-2016/article16944908.ece1 |title=Marathi, Punjabi films that made a mark in 2016 |last=Narayan |first=Hari |date=26 December 2016 |website=[[The Hindu]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161227122321/http://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/Marathi-Punjabi-films-that-made-a-mark-in-2016/article16944908.ece1 |archive-date=27 December 2016 |url-status=live |access-date=21 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra's 'Ventilator' bags 3 National Awards |url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/priyanka-chopra-s-ventilator-bags-3-national-awards-117040700504_1.html |work=Business Standard |date=7 April 2017 |access-date=7 April 2017 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170407234259/http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/priyanka-chopra-s-ventilator-bags-3-national-awards-117040700504_1.html |archive-date=7 April 2017}}</ref> She went on to produce several Indian regional language films, including ''[[Pahuna: The Little Visitors]]'' (2018) and ''Paani'' (2019), which won the [[National Film Award for Best Film on Environment Conservation/Preservation]] at the [[66th National Film Awards]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/regional/priyanka-chopra-on-national-award-win-paani-5893710/ |title=Priyanka Chopra on National Award win: Proud to have produced Paani |website=The Indian Express |date=10 August 2021 |access-date=29 January 2021}}</ref> In 2025, she attached herself as an executive producer on the short film ''[[Anuja (film)|Anuja]]''.<ref name="anuja:variety">{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2025/film/news/priyanka-chopra-jonas-anuja-oscar-shortlist-1236269607/ |title= Priyanka Chopra Jonas Joins Oscar-Shortlisted 'Anuja' as Executive Producer (EXCLUSIVE) |author= Naman Ramachandran |work= [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date= 8 January 2025 |access-date= 9 January 2025 |language=en}}</ref>

Chopra started investing in tech companies in 2018 by investing in a coding education startup called Holberton School and [[Bumble]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/03/technology/priyanka-chopra-tech-investor.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181003180513/https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/03/technology/priyanka-chopra-tech-investor.html |archive-date=3 October 2018 |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |title=Priyanka Chopra Is a Tech Investor, Too |last=Griffith |first=Erin |website=The New York Times |date=3 October 2018 |access-date=29 January 2021}}</ref> [[Bumble]] was launched in India with the help of Chopra in October 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/barrysamaha/2018/10/30/priyanka-chopra-interview-bumble-india-dating-app-whitney-wolfe-herd/?sh=25171f21680b |title=Priyanka Chopra, Whitney Wolfe Herd and Huma Abedin Celebrate the Launch of Bumble India |last=Samaha |first=Barry |website=Forbes |date=30 October 2018 |access-date=29 January 2021}}</ref> In 2021, it was reported that she had invested in the US-based rental marketplace [[Apartment List]].<ref name="startup">{{cite news |url=https://www.businessinsider.in/business/startups/news/priyanka-chopra-jonas-makes-another-tech-investment-this-time-in-us-based-rental-marketplace-apartment-list/articleshow/80554158.cms |title=Priyanka Chopra Jonas makes another tech investment – this time in US-based rental marketplace Apartment List |last=Das |first=Sanchita |website=Business Insider India |date=29 January 2021 |access-date=29 January 2021}}</ref> At the Startup India Prarambh event 2021, Chopra said that "ideas are the currency of the present" and that she was looking forward to further invest in a mix of beauty and tech startups.<ref name="startup" /> The same month, she launched a haircare line called "Anamoly Haircare" which became available exclusively in [[Target Corporation|Target]] stores in the United States on 1 February 2021 and was planned to be available internationally later that year.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.elle.com/beauty/a35353622/priyanka-chopra-anomaly-haircare-line/ |title=Beautiful-Hair-Haver Priyanka Chopra Jonas Is Launching A Haircare Line |last=Yaptangco |first=Ariana |website=Elle |date=29 January 2021 |access-date=29 January 2021}}</ref> In March 2021, Chopra opened her new restaurant ''Sona'' in [[Manhattan]], featuring haute-couture [[Indian cuisine]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foodandwine.com/travel/restaurants/sona-new-york-priyanka-chopra-jonas-restaurant |title=Priyanka Chopra Jonas's New Indian Restaurant Opens in NYC |author=Andy Wang |publisher=Food & Wine |date=24 March 2021 |access-date=13 May 2021 |archive-date=13 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210513154226/https://www.foodandwine.com/travel/restaurants/sona-new-york-priyanka-chopra-jonas-restaurant |url-status=dead }}</ref>

=== Television presenting and stage performances ===
[[File:Priyanka and Ranveer singh.jpg|thumb|upright|Chopra with [[Ranveer Singh]] at an event]]
In 2007, Chopra was on the judges' panel of the Miss India pageant. She stated, "Miss India will always remain special. That's where it all started for me. And maybe that's where it would've ended if I hadn't won the crown."<ref name=mi-special>{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/MirchMasala/Miss-India-is-special-for-Priyanka/Article1-214555.aspx |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120712101922/http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/MirchMasala/Miss-India-is-special-for-Priyanka/Article1-214555.aspx |archive-date=12 July 2012 |title=Miss India is special for Priyanka |work=Hindustan Times |date=9 April 2007 |url-status=dead |access-date=15 March 2012}}</ref> She also served as a judge at [[Miss World 2009]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/miss-world-09/india-@-miss-world-09/story/miss-world-will-not-change-the-world-priyanka-chopra-62978-2009-12-13 |title=Miss World will not change the world: Priyanka Chopra |work=India Today |date=14 December 2009 |access-date=28 November 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114044743/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/Miss+World+will+not+change+the+world:+Priyanka+Chopra/1/74933.html |archive-date=14 November 2012 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/InterviewsCinema/With-seven-awards-it-s-been-a-fantastic-start-Priyanka-Chopra/Article1-397523.aspx |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120712035549/http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/InterviewsCinema/With-seven-awards-it-s-been-a-fantastic-start-Priyanka-Chopra/Article1-397523.aspx |archive-date=12 July 2012 |title=With seven awards, it's been a 'fantastic' start: Priyanka Chopra |work=Hindustan Times |date=6 April 2009 |url-status=dead |access-date=16 March 2012}}</ref> She visited [[Jawans|Jawan]] troops in [[Arunachal Pradesh|Tenga]], in eastern India, for a special episode of the NDTV show ''Jai Jawan'' celebrating the 60th anniversary of India's independence.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ndtv.com/video/player/jai-jawan/jai-jawan-with-priyanka-chopra/16141 |title=Jai Jawan with Priyanka Chopra (video) |publisher=NDTV |date=15 August 2007 |access-date=5 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120904132825/http://www.ndtv.com/video/player/jai-jawan/jai-jawan-with-priyanka-chopra/16141 |archive-date=4 September 2012}}</ref>

In 2010, she hosted the third season of the reality show ''[[Khatron Ke Khiladi (TV series)|Fear Factor: Khatron Ke Khiladi]]'' on the [[Colors (TV channel)|Colors]] channel, taking over from previous host Akshay Kumar.<ref name=toiff>{{cite news |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Priyanka-is-Hitler-in-Brazil/articleshow/6426356.cms |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130616021215/http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-08-24/news-interviews/28285017_1_priyanka-chopra-stunts-fear-factor |url-status=live |archive-date=16 June 2013 |title=Priyanka is Hitler in Brazil |date=24 August 2010 |work=[[The Times of India]] |access-date=7 May 2013}}</ref> According to contestants, in hosting the series, Chopra had "transformed into quite a whip-wielding dictator", relentlessly pushing the contestants to work.<ref name=toiff /> She performed most of her own stunts, adamant to prove that she could rival Akshay Kumar, who had hosted the previous two seasons.<ref name=toiff /> The opening ratings of the show topped those of the two previous seasons.<ref>{{cite news |agency=Indo-Asian News Service |title=Khatron Ke Khiladi 3 TRPs break record |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Khatron-Ke-Khiladi-3-opening-TRP-ratings-breaks-record/Article1-600561.aspx |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100918001655/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Khatron-Ke-Khiladi-3-opening-TRP-ratings-breaks-record/Article1-600561.aspx |archive-date=18 September 2010 |work=Hindustan Times |date=15 September 2010 |url-status=dead |access-date=28 September 2010}}</ref> The show was praised by critics, and earned her the [[Indian Telly Awards|Indian Telly Award]] for Most Impactful Debut on Television.<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka to leave for Brazil on Aug 15 for Khatron Ke Khiladi |url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2010/jul/190710-Priyanka-Chopra-Brazil-August-15-Khatron-Ke-Khiladi.htm |work=[[Mid-Day]] |date=19 July 2010 |access-date=5 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130615021927/http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2010/jul/190710-Priyanka-Chopra-Brazil-August-15-Khatron-Ke-Khiladi.htm |archive-date=15 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=The Tenth Indian Telly Awards |url=http://tellyawards.indiantelevision.com/y2k10/winners.php |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016040245/http://tellyawards.indiantelevision.com/y2k10/winners.php |archive-date=16 October 2013 |publisher=[[Indian Telly Awards]] |access-date=5 September 2012}}</ref> In February 2016, Chopra presented the award for [[Academy Award for Best Film Editing|Best Film Editing]] at the [[88th Academy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/oscars-2016-priyanka-chopra-debut-bollywood-friends-fans-congratulate-twitter-kamal-haasan/ |title=Watch: Priyanka Chopra presents the Oscar for Best Film Editing |work=The New Indian Express |date=29 February 2016 |access-date=29 February 2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160301093540/http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/oscars-2016-priyanka-chopra-debut-bollywood-friends-fans-congratulate-twitter-kamal-haasan/ |archive-date=1 March 2016}}</ref>

Chopra has participated in a number of world tours and concerts. She took part in a world concert tour, "Temptations 2004", and performed with other Bollywood actors (including Shah Rukh Khan, [[Saif Ali Khan]], [[Rani Mukerji]], Preity Zinta and [[Arjun Rampal]]) in 19 stage shows.<ref>{{cite web |title=Temptation 2004 |url=http://www.sify.com/movies/Temptation-2004-imagegallery-events-jdwmFcichfa.html?html=5 |website=[[Sify]] |access-date=19 March 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114044716/http://www.sify.com/movies/Temptation-2004-imagegallery-events-jdwmFcichfa.html?html=5 |archive-date=14 November 2012}}</ref> In 2011, she participated (with Shahid Kapoor and Shah Rukh Khan) in a concert in [[Durban]], South Africa celebrating 150 years of India–South Africa friendship.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://gulfnews.com/life-style/general/priyanka-chopra-namaste-south-africa-1.742494 |title=Priyanka Chopra: Namaste South Africa |work=[[Gulf News]] |date=8 January 2011 |access-date=13 February 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130521025718/http://gulfnews.com/life-style/general/priyanka-chopra-namaste-south-africa-1.742494 |archive-date=21 May 2013}}</ref> In 2012, she performed at [[M. A. Chidambaram Stadium]], [[Chennai]] in the [[2012 Indian Premier League opening ceremony|opening ceremony]] of the [[2012 Indian Premier League|fifth season]] of cricket's [[Indian Premier League]] with Amitabh Bachchan, Salman Khan, Kareena Kapoor and Katy Perry.<ref>{{cite news |author=Datta, Dwaipayan |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/news/ipl-2012-opening-ceremony-ipl-party-begins-with-star-studded-opening-ceremony-as-fans-swoon/articleshow/12524604.cms |title=IPL 2012 Opening Ceremony: IPL party begins with star-studded opening ceremony as fans swoon |work=The Times of India |date=4 April 2012 |access-date=14 September 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120623074204/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl-2012/news/IPL-2012-Opening-Ceremony-IPL-party-begins-with-star-studded-opening-ceremony-as-fans-swoon/articleshow/12524604.cms |archive-date=23 June 2012}}</ref> The same year, she performed at [[Dubai Festival City]]'s Ahlan Bollywood Concert with other Bollywood stars such as Salman Khan and [[Sophie Choudry]].<ref>{{cite news |author=Eldemerdash, Nadia |url=http://gulfnews.com/pictures/arts-entertainment/stars-hit-the-stage-at-the-ahlan-bollywood-concert-1.1113630 |title=Stars hit the stage at the Ahlan Bollywood concert |work=Gulf News |date=3 December 2012 |access-date=11 December 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121209104631/http://gulfnews.com/pictures/arts-entertainment/stars-hit-the-stage-at-the-ahlan-bollywood-concert-1.1113630 |archive-date=9 December 2012}}</ref>

In 2021, Chopra along with her husband [[Nick Jonas]], announced the nominees for the [[93rd Academy Awards]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas steal an Oscar after announcing nominees. See funny pic |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/hollywood/priyanka-chopra-and-nick-jonas-steal-an-oscar-after-announcing-nominees-see-funny-pic-101615854170746.html |access-date=16 March 2021 |work=[[Hindustan Times]] |date=16 March 2021}}</ref>

=== Writing ===
Chopra began writing an opinion column for the ''Hindustan Times'' in 2009. She wrote a total of 50 columns for the newspaper. She said after her first year of writing: "I'm a private person and never thought that I could express my feelings. But strangely enough, whenever I sat down to write this column, my inner most thoughts came to the fore."<ref>{{cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra turns 50 |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Lifestyle/CelebWatch/Priyanka-Chopra-turns-50/Article1-512840.aspx |work=Hindustan Times |author=Chopra, Priyanka |date=26 February 2010 |access-date=5 September 2012 |archive-date=19 August 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130819000208/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Lifestyle/CelebWatch/Priyanka-Chopra-turns-50/Article1-512840.aspx |url-status=dead}}</ref> In March 2009, she met several readers who had submitted feedback on her weekly column.<ref>{{cite news |title=Hi, it's Priyanka |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/Entertainment/Hi-it-s-Priyanka/Article1-388701.aspx |work=Hindustan Times |author=Neha Sharma and Garima Sharma |date=12 March 2009 |access-date=5 September 2012 |archive-date=13 May 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513065918/http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/Entertainment/Hi-it-s-Priyanka/Article1-388701.aspx |url-status=dead}}</ref> She continued to write sporadically for newspapers. In August 2012 she wrote a column published in ''[[The Times of India]]'' titled "No woman in Mumbai feels safe any longer", discussing the murder of 25-year-old Pallavi Purkayastha,<ref name="TOI column">{{cite news |title=No woman in Mumbai feels safe any longer: Priyanka Chopra |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/No-woman-in-Mumbai-feels-safe-any-longer-Priyanka-Chopra/articleshow/15545055.cms |work=The Times of India |author=Chopra, Priyanka |date=19 August 2012 |access-date=5 September 2012 |archive-date=2 January 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150102225605/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/news-interviews/No-woman-in-Mumbai-feels-safe-any-longer-Priyanka-Chopra/articleshow/15545055.cms?referral=PM |url-status=live}}</ref> whom she met while working on ''Don''.<ref name=NDTV-int /> In the article, Chopra expressed her views about the safety of women in cities.<ref name="TOI column" /> In a July 2014 article published in ''[[The Guardian]]'', Chopra criticised [[female genital mutilation]] and [[child marriage]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Priyanka Chopra: when girls are empowered, we all do better |url=https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/poverty-matters/2014/jul/22/priyanka-chopra-girl-summit-female-genital-mutilation-child-marriage |author=Chopra, Priyanka |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=21 July 2014 |access-date=21 February 2015 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150529121433/http://www.theguardian.com/global-development/poverty-matters/2014/jul/22/priyanka-chopra-girl-summit-female-genital-mutilation-child-marriage |archive-date=29 May 2015}}</ref>

Later that year, Chopra wrote an op-ed for ''[[The New York Times]]'' titled "What [[Jane Austen]] Knew" about the importance of education for girls. She praised and quoted [[Nobel Peace Prize]] winners [[Malala Yousafzai]] and [[Kailash Satyarthi]], and described how her desire to help others was triggered when, at 9, she joined her parents while they volunteered their spare time to offer modern health care to the rural poor.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/04/opinion/priyanka-chopra-on-educating-girls.html?WT.mc_id=D-NYT-MKTG-MOD-28808-12-20-HD&WT.mc_ev=click&WT.mc_c= |title=What Jane Austen Knew: Priyanka Chopra on Educating Girls |work=[[The New York Times]] |author=Chopra, Priyanka |date=4 December 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141207100214/http://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/04/opinion/priyanka-chopra-on-educating-girls.html |archive-date=7 December 2014 |access-date=30 December 2014 |url-status=live |quote=What had they done wrong? My parents tried to explain as best they could the stigma that surrounded and still surrounds girls in our country. How do you explain that to a 9-year-old? What I took away from the discussion was that the parents we met believed that their sons were better than their daughters. It rankled. I couldn't understand why, but from that moment, I vowed to help those girls as much as I could.}}</ref> In late 2014, Chopra began writing a monthly column, "Pret-a-Priyanka", for ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]''. In an article published in January 2015, she expressed her views on diversity and being a global citizen.<ref>{{cite magazine |title='The Girl Next Door Should Look Like the Girl Next Door': Priyanka Chopra on Diversity |url=http://www.elle.com/culture/career-politics/news/a26052/priyanka-chopra-on-diversity/ |author=Chopra, Priyanka |magazine=Elle |date=16 January 2015 |access-date=21 February 2015 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150221200421/http://www.elle.com/culture/career-politics/news/a26052/priyanka-chopra-on-diversity/ |archive-date=21 February 2015}}</ref> Released by [[Penguin Random House]], Chopra published her first memoir titled ''[[Unfinished (book)|Unfinished]]'' on 9 February 2021.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/review-priyanka-chopra-jonas-reveals-private-life-details-75753999 |title=Review: Priyanka Chopra Jonas reveals private life details |last=Sprayregen |first=Molly |website=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]] |date=8 February 2021 |access-date=9 February 2021}}</ref> In a rave review, [[Associated Press]]'s Molly Sprayregen termed the book "deeply open and honest account" and wrote "Chopra Jonas' writing is open, engaging, and full of energy. She writes, it seems, to connect. The experience feels intimate, like Chopra Jonas is exchanging stories with a friend over coffee. Her stories are exceedingly personal, and despite being an international movie star, many of them even feel relatable."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/review-priyanka-chopra-jonas-reveals-private-life-details-75753999 |title=Review: Priyanka Chopra Jonas reveals private life details |last=Sprayregen |first=Molly |website=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]] |date=8 February 2021 |access-date=23 February 2021}}</ref> ''Unfinished'' reached [[The New York Times Best Seller list|''The New York Times'' Best Seller list]] in the United States.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/hardcover-nonfiction/ |title=Hardcover Nonfiction – Best Sellers – Books |website=The New York Times |date=28 February 2021 |access-date=23 February 2021}}</ref>
