On October 1, they are set to perform in Buenos Aires at the [[Estadio G.E.B.A.]]<ref name="oceanup3">{{cite web |url=http://www.oceanup.com/2011/july/09/nick-jonas-2011-tour |title=Nick Jonas 2011 TOUR |publisher=oceanUP.com |date=2011-07-09 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-date=2013-09-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130906040156/http://oceanup.com/2011/july/09/nick-jonas-2011-tour |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fenix.com.ar/ |title=Fenix Entertainment Group |publisher=Fenix.com.ar |access-date=2012-03-28}}</ref>
On July 12 Nick announced through Facebook that there will more shows in South America.<ref name="facebook.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/nickjonas |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Facebook |access-date=2012-03-28}}</ref>
On July 14 Nick announced a concert in Chile on October 4.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/07/nick-jonas-concert-on-104-in-santiago-pre-sale-begins-july-14-10am-clt/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-07-14 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111007055850/http://nickjonline.com/2011/07/nick-jonas-concert-on-104-in-santiago-pre-sale-begins-july-14-10am-clt/ |archive-date=2011-10-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
On July 21 he announced a concert in Paraguay<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reduts.com.py/conciertos/nick-jonas-2011-tour-en-venta-desde-el-22-de-julio-1700-hs.html |access-date=July 21, 2011 |title=RED UTS - Entrá a tu evento }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/07/nick-jonas-the-administration-paraguay-on-sept-29th/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-07-21 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111007060026/http://nickjonline.com/2011/07/nick-jonas-the-administration-paraguay-on-sept-29th/ |archive-date=2011-10-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
He announced a second concert in Argentine on July 22.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vos.lavoz.com.ar/pop/rock/nick-jonas-actuara-cordoba/ |title=Nick Jonas actuarĂĄ en CĂłrdoba |date=22 July 2011 |publisher=Vos.lavoz.com.ar |access-date=2012-03-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/07/nick-jonas-and-the-administration-will-performance-in-cordoba-on-october-2/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-07-23 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209032354/http://nickjonline.com/2011/07/nick-jonas-and-the-administration-will-performance-in-cordoba-on-october-2/ |archive-date=2014-12-09 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
On August 2 Nick confirmed five concerts in Brazil and one in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/08/nick-jonas-heading-to-brazil-details-and-dates-here/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-08-02 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209032029/http://nickjonline.com/2011/08/nick-jonas-heading-to-brazil-details-and-dates-here/ |archive-date=2014-12-09 |url-status=usurped }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/08/nick-jonas-the-administration-heading-to-caracasvenezuela-on-october-8-2011/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-08-02 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209035249/http://nickjonline.com/2011/08/nick-jonas-the-administration-heading-to-caracasvenezuela-on-october-8-2011/ |archive-date=2014-12-09 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
On August 5, 2011, there was an announcement from Nick through his Facebook page about a concert in Uruguay.<ref name="facebook.com"/>

On September 3, 2011, nick announced through Twitter that ''Ocean Grove Band'' will be going on tour with them.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/intent/user?screen_name=nickjonas |title=Nick Jonas (@nickjonas) op Twitter |publisher=Twitter.com |access-date=2012-03-28}}</ref> On September 6, a concert in Puerto Rico was announced.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.primerahora.com/nickjonasregresaalaislacomosolista-548131.html |title=Nick Jonas regresa a la Isla como solista |publisher=Primerahora.com |date=2011-09-06 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-date=2012-10-04 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121004161913/http://www.primerahora.com/nickjonasregresaalaislacomosolista-548131.html |url-status=dead }}</ref>
On September 21, the first day of the tour, it was announced that Jonas' last concert date of the tour ([[San Juan, Puerto Rico|San Juan]], [[Puerto Rico]] on October 11) was cancelled. The producer of the Puerto Rico date, César Sainz, confirmed the information the same day. Nick's reason to cancel the last show was that his training for the role of J. Pierrepont Finch, which will replace [[Harry Potter (film series)|Harry Potter]] actor [[Daniel Radcliffe]] and [[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'s [[Darren Criss]], in the revival of Broadway's [[How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying (musical)|How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying]] will take place in Los Angeles starting on October 10.<ref name="Nick Jonas cancels ENDI">{{cite web|url=http://www.elnuevodia.com/nickjonascancelaconciertoenpuertorico-1072959.html|title=Portada - El Nuevo Día|work=El Nuevo Dia|access-date=11 March 2015|date=2011-09-21|archive-date=2014-12-24|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141224112232/http://www.elnuevodia.com/nickjonascancelaconciertoenpuertorico-1072959.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> On September 23, the news was confirmed via Nick Jonas' website.<ref name="Nick Jonas cancels Nick J Online.com">{{cite web|url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/09/nick-jonas-canceling-show-in-puerto-rico/|title=Nick J Online - Nick Jonas|access-date=11 March 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141108100319/http://nickjonline.com/2011/09/nick-jonas-canceling-show-in-puerto-rico/|archive-date=8 November 2014|url-status=usurped|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

On December 13, 2011, a video of Nick performing Last Time Around was posted online as part of a new internet serie Fandrop. The video shows some lucky fans seeing Nick Jonas & the administration rehearse for the Nick jonas 2011 Tour.<ref name="Nick Jonas">{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/articlevideo-fandrop-nick-jonas-episode-one-last-time-around/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-12-13 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209031928/http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/articlevideo-fandrop-nick-jonas-episode-one-last-time-around/ |archive-date=2014-12-09 |url-status=usurped }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Hinojosa |first=Stacy |url=http://www.cambio.com/2011/12/09/nick-jonas-surprises-fans-with-secret-concert-in-new-fandrop-w/ |title=Nick Jonas Surprises Fans With Secret Concert In New "FanDrop" Web Series on Cambio |publisher=Cambio.com |date=2011-12-09 |access-date=2012-03-28}}</ref>
On December 14 a teaser for the next episode went online, it shows Nick talking about Conspiracy Theory. The second episode will premiere December 15, 2011<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=28737 |title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » Teaser for Episode No.&nbsp;2 of Nick's Fan Drop on Cambio |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |date=2011-12-14 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407011627/http://jonasworld.org/?p=28737 |archive-date=2012-04-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
On December 15 the second episode went online it shows the performance of Conspiracy Theory by Nick Jonas & the Administration.<ref name="JonasWorld.Org">{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=28754 |title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » Nick's Fan Drop: Episode 2 – Conspiracy Theory |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407011634/http://jonasworld.org/?p=28754 |archive-date=2012-04-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/articlevideo-fandrop-nick-jonas-episode-2-conspiracy-theory/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-12-15 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120112102536/http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/articlevideo-fandrop-nick-jonas-episode-2-conspiracy-theory/ |archive-date=2012-01-12 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
On December 16 a teaser for the next episode went online, it shows Nick playing the intro of Who I Am. This episode will premiere December 20, 2011<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=28778 |title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » Teaser for Fan Drop Episode No.&nbsp;3 |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |date=2011-12-16 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407011641/http://jonasworld.org/?p=28778 |archive-date=2012-04-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
On December 20, the episode was online, it shows Nick performing Who I Am.<ref name="nickjonline2">{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/videos-fandrop-episode-3-4-teasers-nick-jonas/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-12-20 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120519064104/http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/videos-fandrop-episode-3-4-teasers-nick-jonas/ |archive-date=2012-05-19 |url-status=usurped }}</ref><ref name="jonasworld-28806">{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=28806 |title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » FanDrop Nick Jonas: Episode Three – "Who I Am" |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |date=2011-12-20 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407011649/http://jonasworld.org/?p=28806 |archive-date=2012-04-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref> Alongside a teaser for episode 4 went online, it shows Nick warming up his vocals for the last episode; which airs December 22, 2011.<ref name="nickjonline2"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wetpaint.com/network/video/first-look-nick-jonas-on-the-finale-of-fandrop |title=Must Watch Video: Nick Jonas on the Finale of FanDrop - Video |publisher=wetpaint.com |access-date=2012-03-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=28796 |title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » Nick's Fan Drop: Episode 4 Teaser |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |date=2011-12-20 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407011707/http://jonasworld.org/?p=28796 |archive-date=2012-04-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
On December 22, the last episode airs, it shows Nick Jonas & the Administration performing their version of the [[Jonas Brothers]] song Inseparable.<ref name="nickjonline">{{cite web |url=http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/video-fandrop-nick-jonas-episode-4-inseparable/ |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2011-12-22 |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209033556/http://nickjonline.com/2011/12/video-fandrop-nick-jonas-episode-4-inseparable/ |archive-date=2014-12-09 |url-status=usurped }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=28820 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407011714/http://jonasworld.org/?p=28820|archive-date=2012-04-07|title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » FanDrop Nick Jonas – Episode No.&nbsp;4 {{sic|Insep|erable|nolink=yes|expected=inseparable}} |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |date=2011-12-22 |url-status=usurped |access-date=2012-03-28}}</ref>

===2012&ndash;2016: Leaving Label, Jonas Brothers Tours, hiatus, reunion===
It was announced on May 2, 2012, that the band had parted ways with their record label Hollywood Records; Jonas bought the rights of their music.<ref name="nickjonline3"/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=30330 |title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » Jonas Brothers Part Ways With Disney's Hollywood Records |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |access-date=2012-05-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120510135112/http://jonasworld.org/?p=30330 |archive-date=2012-05-10 |url-status=usurped }}</ref> On May 20, 2012, Nick performed an acoustic version of the songs ''Who I Am'' and ''Last Time Around'' in a six-song acoustic set between two shows of [[How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying (musical)|How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying]].<ref name="http://jonasworld.org/?p=30668">{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=30668 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120709070638/http://jonasworld.org/?p=30668 |url-status=usurped |archive-date=2012-07-09 |title=Jonasworld.org |publisher=Jonasworld.org |access-date=2015-01-29 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://nickjonline.com/2012/05/article-nick-jonas-sings-what-makes-you-beautiful-acoustic-set-video/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130403221750/http://nickjonline.com/2012/05/article-nick-jonas-sings-what-makes-you-beautiful-acoustic-set-video/ |url-status=usurped |archive-date=April 3, 2013 |title=Nick Jonas |publisher=Nick J Online |date=2012-05-24 |access-date=2015-01-29}}</ref>

# Gotta Find You
# [[Lovebug (Jonas Brothers song)|Lovebug]]
# [[What Makes You Beautiful]] <small>([[One Direction]] cover)</small>
# [[Just the Way You Are (Bruno Mars song)|Just the Way You Are]]  <small>([[Bruno Mars]] cover)</small>
# [[Who I Am (Nick Jonas & the Administration song)|Who I Am]]
}}

The songs "Who I Am" & "Last Time Around" were performed during all of the [[Jonas Brothers tours#Jonas Brothers World Tour 2012/2013|Jonas Brothers World Tour 2012/2013]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1695405/jonas-brothers-miley-cyrus-wedding-bells.jhtml |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130104072338/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1695405/jonas-brothers-miley-cyrus-wedding-bells.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=January 4, 2013 |title=Jonas Brothers Debut New Songs At Reunion Show (Is One About Miley?) |publisher=MTV |date=2012-10-12 |access-date=2015-01-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.setlist.fm/setlist/jonas-brothers/2012/mall-of-asia-concert-grounds-pasay-city-philippines-2bdd78be.html |title=Jonas Brothers Concert Setlist at Mall of Asia Arena, Pasay on October 19, 2012 |publisher=setlist.fm |access-date=2015-01-29}}</ref>
During the concert in Monterrey Mexico the songs  "Stay" and "State of Emergency" were also performed.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=33174 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130415043218/http://jonasworld.org/?p=33174 |url-status=usurped |archive-date=2013-04-15 |title=Jonasworld.org |publisher=Jonasworld.org |access-date=2015-01-29 }}</ref> Stay was performed again in Rio de Janeiro on March 12, 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=33497 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130415040145/http://jonasworld.org/?p=33497 |url-status=usurped |archive-date=2013-04-15 |title=Jonasworld.org |publisher=Jonasworld.org |access-date=2015-01-29 }}</ref>
The songs "Who I Am" & "Last Time Around" were performed again as part of the main setlist during  the [[List of Jonas Brothers concert tours#Jonas Brothers World Tour 2012/2013|Jonas Brothers Live Tour]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alterthepress.com/2013/07/jonas-brothers-2013-summer-tour-set-list.html |title=Jonas Brothers 2013 Summer Tour Set List |publisher=Alter The Press! |access-date=2015-01-29}}</ref> On July 29, ''Stay'' was also performed and on July 30 ''Vesper's Goodbye''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=34708 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130730041754/http://jonasworld.org/?p=34708 |url-status=usurped |archive-date=2013-07-30 |title=Jonasworld.org |publisher=Jonasworld.org |access-date=2015-01-29 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=34710 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130801090255/http://jonasworld.org/?p=34710 |url-status=usurped |archive-date=2013-08-01 |title=Jonasworld.org |publisher=Jonasworld.org |access-date=2015-01-29 }}</ref> On July 31, ''Stay'' was performed with [[Sonny T.|Sonny Thompson]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/JonasBrothersChileOficial/posts/635152276502708 |title=Les dejo el Set list del concierto de... - Jonas Brothers Chile |publisher=Facebook |date=2013-07-31 |access-date=2015-01-29}}</ref>

On August 31, 2016, Jonas announced that the band would reunite for a one night only concert in Minneapolis, Minnesota on the same day. The show quickly sold out in less than two hours. The band performed every song from their debut album along with ''Stay'' and ''Inseparable'' from 2007's [[Jonas Brothers (album)|Jonas Brothers]].

}}

==Band members==
;Current members<ref name="members">{{cite web |url=http://www.oceanup.com/2009/11/17/nick-jonas-on-the-administration-album |title=Nick Jonas On The Administration ALBUM |publisher=oceanUP.com |date=2009-11-17 |access-date=2011-03-15 |archive-date=2019-03-07 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190307001056/http://oceanup.com/2009/11/17/nick-jonas-on-the-administration-album/ |url-status=dead }}</ref>
* [[Nick Jonas]] - lead vocals, rhythm guitar, drums, piano <small>(since 2009)</small>
* [[John Fields (producer)|John Fields]] - bass, backing vocals <small>(since 2009)</small>
* [[Michael Bland]] - drums, percussion, backing vocals <small>(since 2009)</small>
* [[Tommy Barbarella]] - synthesizers, keyboards <small>(since 2009)</small>
* [[Sonny T.|Sonny Thompson]] - lead guitar, backing vocals <small>(since 2009)</small>

;Former members<ref name="members"/><ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/music/news/2009-11-12-nick-jonas_N.htm | work=USA Today | first=Brian | last=Mansfield | title=A solo JoBro: Nick's album has a 'more rootsy' sound | date=2009-11-20}}</ref>
* [[David Ryan Harris]] - lead guitar, backing vocals <small>(2009)</small>

;Touring members<ref>{{cite web|work=Twitter|url=https://twitter.com/marcuskincyST/status/118834391270166528|title=Me SonnyT @thebeetmaker @dunham_josh & The Bro @nickjonas ....ShowTime|access-date=November 1, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://jonasworld.org/?p=26905 |title=JonasHQ.Org &#124; Your No.&nbsp;1 Fansite and Exclusive Source for the Jonas Brothers » Nick's band (photo) |publisher=JonasWorld.Org |access-date=2012-03-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407011537/http://jonasworld.org/?p=26905 |archive-date=2012-04-07 |url-status=usurped }}</ref>
* Chris Bailey - drums <small>(2011)</small>
* Joshua Dunham - rhythm guitar, lead guitar <small>(2011)</small>
* Marcus Kincy -  keyboards <small>(2011)</small>

List of awards and nominations received by Nick Jonas & the Administration.

===Teen Choice Awards===
The Teen Choice Awards is an annual awards show established in 1999 by the Fox Broadcasting Company. Nick Jonas & the Administration have received 2 nominations.

{{Infobox website
 |name= AllMusic
 |logo= [[File:AllMusic Logo.svg|frameless|45px]]&nbsp;[[File:AllMusic Text Logo.svg|180px|frameless]]
 |screenshot =
 |logocaption= [[Logotype]] and [[wordmark]] {{nowrap|since July 2013}}

 |commercial= Yes
 |type= [[List of online music databases|Online database]] for music albums, artists and songs; reviews and biographies
 |registration= Optional
 |language= English
 |programming_language =
 |owner= [[RhythmOne]] (since 2015)<ref name="rhythmone">{{cite web |url=https://investor.rhythmone.com/newsroom/2015/04/16/blinkx-acquires-all-media-network-llc |title=blinkx acquires All Media Network, LLC |website=Newsroom – RhythmOne |access-date=August 22, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171103022705/https://investor.rhythmone.com/newsroom/2015/04/16/blinkx-acquires-all-media-network-llc |archive-date=November 3, 2017 |date=April 16, 2015 |url-status=unfit }}</ref>
 |author= [[Michael Erlewine]]
 |launch_date= {{start date and age|1991}} (as All Music Guide)
 |current_status= [[Online]]

'''AllMusic''' (previously known as '''All-Music Guide''' and '''AMG''') is an American [[online database|online music database]]. It catalogs more than three million [[album]] entries and 30 million tracks, as well as information on [[Musical artist|musicians]] and [[Musical ensemble|bands]]. Initiated in 1991, the database was first made available on the Internet in 1994.<ref name="Wired" /><ref name="Metro" /> AllMusic has been owned by [[RhythmOne]] since 2015.

==History==
AllMusic was launched as ''All-Music Guide'' by [[Michael Erlewine]], a "compulsive archivist, noted astrologer, Buddhist scholar, and musician". He became interested in using computers for his astrological work in the mid-1970s and founded a software company, Matrix, in 1977. In the early 1990s, as [[compact disc]]s (CDs) replaced [[LP record|LPs]] and [[cassette (format)|cassettes]] as the dominant format for recorded music, Erlewine purchased what he thought was a CD of early recordings by [[Little Richard]]. After buying it, he discovered it was a "flaccid latter-day rehash".<ref name="Metro" /> Frustrated with the labeling, he researched using [[metadata]] to create a music guide.<ref name="Videoland book">{{cite book |last1=Herbert |first1=Daniel |title=Videoland: Movie Culture at the American Video Store |date=January 24, 2014 |publisher=University of California Press |location=Los Angeles, CA |isbn=978-0520279636 |page=209 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=lV98AgAAQBAJ&q=All+Music+Guide+Michael+Erlewine+founded+astrologer&pg=PA209 |access-date=July 20, 2017}}</ref> In 1990, in [[Big Rapids, Michigan]], he founded ''All Music Guide'' with a goal to create an open-access database that included every recording "since [[Enrico Caruso]] gave the industry its first big boost".<ref name="Wired" />

The first ''All Music Guide'', published in 1992, was a 1,200-page reference book, packaged with a CD-ROM, titled ''All Music Guide: The Best CDs, Albums & Tapes: The Expert's Guide to the Best Releases from Thousands of Artists in All Types of Music''.<ref name="AllMusic1stEdition">{{cite book | last1=Erlewine | first1=Michael | last2=Bultman | first2=Scott | title=All Music Guide: The Best Cds, Albums & Tapes : The Experts' Guide to the Best Releases from Thousands of Artists in All Types of Music | publisher=Backbeat Books | date=1992 | isbn=978-0-87930-264-1 | oclc=27307106 }}</ref> Its first online version, in 1994, was a text-based [[Gopher (protocol) |Gopher]] site.<ref name="Wired" /><ref name="Vice history">{{cite news |last1=Nosowitz |first1=Dan |title=The Story of AllMusic, Which Predates the World Wide Web |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/the-internets-most-complete-guide-to-music/ |access-date=June 22, 2017 |work=[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]] |date=January 30, 2015}}</ref> It moved to the [[World Wide Web]] as [[web browser]]s became more user-friendly.<ref name="Metro" />

Erlewine hired a database engineer, [[Vladimir Bogdanov (editor)|Vladimir Bogdanov]], to design the ''All Music Guide'' framework, and recruited his nephew, writer [[Stephen Thomas Erlewine]], to develop editorial content. In 1993, Chris Woodstra joined the staff as an engineer. A "record geek" who had written for alternative weeklies and fanzines, his main qualification was an "encyclopedic knowledge of music".<ref name="Metro" /> Allmusic developed a list of 1,400 subgenres of music, a feature that became central to the site's utility. In a 2016 article in ''Tedium'', Ernie Smith wrote: "AllMusic may have been one of the most ambitious sites of the early-internet era—and it's one that is fundamental to our understanding of pop culture. Because the thing is, it doesn't just track reviews or albums. It tracks styles, genres, and subgenres, along with the tone of the music and the platforms on which the music is sold. It then connects that data together, in a way that can intelligently tell you about an entire type of music, whether a massive genre like classical, or a tiny one like [[sadcore]]."<ref name="big data smith">{{cite web |last1=Smith |first1=Ernie |title=The Big Data Jukebox |url=https://tedium.co/2016/09/20/allmusic-database-historic-importance/ |website=tedium.com |publisher=Tedium |access-date=July 26, 2017 |date=September 20, 2016}}</ref>

In 1996, seeking to further develop its web-based businesses, Alliance Entertainment Corp. bought All Music from Erlewine for a reported $3.5 million. He left the company after its sale.<ref name="Metro" /> Alliance filed for bankruptcy in 1999, and its assets were acquired by [[Ron Burkle]]'s Yucaipa Equity Fund.<ref name="Videoland book" />

In 1999, All Music relocated from Big Rapids to [[Ann Arbor, Michigan]], where the staff expanded from 12 to 100 people.<ref name="Metro" /> By February of that year, 350,000 albums and two million tracks had been cataloged. All Music had published biographies of 30,000 artists, 120,000 record reviews, and 300 essays written by "a hybrid of historians, critics, and passionate collectors".<ref name="Weisbard Voice">{{cite news |last1=Weisbard |first1=Eric |title=Conjunction Junction |url=https://www.villagevoice.com/1999/02/23/conjunction-junction/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825021041/https://www.villagevoice.com/1999/02/23/conjunction-junction/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=August 25, 2017 |access-date=July 22, 2017 |work=[[The Village Voice]] |date=February 23, 1999}}</ref><ref name="NPR">{{cite news |last=Powers |first=Ann |date=June 3, 2015 |title=Digital Underground Who Will Make Sure the Internet's Vast Musical Archive Doesn't Disappear? |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2015/06/03/411666224/digital-underground |work=The Record |publisher=[[NPR]] |access-date=July 20, 2017}}</ref>

In late 2007, AllMusic was purchased for $72 million by [[TiVo Corporation]] (known as Macrovision at the time of the sale, and as Rovi from 2009 until 2016).<ref>{{cite web |title=Focus Article: Rovi Corporation |url=https://www.insidearbitrage.com/2012/10/weekly-focus-article-rovi-corporation-rovi/ |website=insidearbitrage.com |publisher=Inside Arbitrage |date=October 1, 2012 |access-date=September 28, 2017}}</ref> In 2012, AllMusic removed all of [[Bryan Adams]]' info from the site per a request from the artist.<ref>{{cite web |title=FAQ |url=https://www.allmusic.com/faq/topic/bryanadams |publisher=AllMusic |access-date=September 17, 2019 |language=en-us}}</ref>

In 2015, AllMusic was purchased by BlinkX, later known as [[RhythmOne]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Blinkx Acquires Website Owner All Media Network For Undisclosed Amount |first=Sam |last=Unsted |publisher=London South East |date=April 16, 2015 |url=http://www.lse.co.uk/AllNews.asp?code=64stlp40&headline=Blinkx_Acquires_Website_Owner_All_Media_Network_For_Undisclosed_Amount |archive-date=May 5, 2015 |access-date=February 19, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150505021121/http://www.lse.co.uk/AllNews.asp?code=64stlp40&headline=Blinkx_Acquires_Website_Owner_All_Media_Network_For_Undisclosed_Amount |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref name="rhythmone"/> The AllMusic database is powered by a combination of [[MySQL]] and [[MongoDB]].<ref name="ernie smith vice">{{cite news |last1=Smith |first1=Ernie |title=The Story of AllMusic, the Internet's Largest, Most Influential Music Database |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/the-story-of-allmusic-the-internets-largest-most-influential-music-database/ |website=Vice |access-date=July 20, 2017 |date=September 16, 2016}}</ref>

==The All Music Guide series==
The All Media Network produced the ''All Music Guide: The Definitive Guide'' (at first released as ''The Experts' Guide''),<ref name="Metro">{{cite news |url=http://www2.metrotimes.com/editorial/story.asp?id=10087 |title=Make it or Break it |last=Bowe |first=Brian J. |date=January 24, 2007 |newspaper=[[Metro Times]] |access-date=February 27, 2014 |archive-date=January 15, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130115132323/http://www2.metrotimes.com/editorial/story.asp?id=10087 |url-status=dead }}</ref> which includes a series of publications about various music genres. It was followed by the ''Required Listening'' series, and Annual guides. [[Vladimir Bogdanov (editor) |Vladimir Bogdanov]] is the president and the main editor of the series.<ref name="Billboard">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/1179058/allmusiccom-folding-into-allrovicom-for-one-stop-entertainment-shop |title=AllMusic.com Folding Into AllRovi.com for One-Stop Entertainment Shop |last=Bruno |first=Anthony |date=February 28, 2011 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine) |Billboard]] |access-date=June 15, 2013}}</ref>

* ''All Music Guide: The Definitive Guide to Popular Music'' (1st edition: 1992, 2nd ed: 1994, 3rd ed: 1997, 4th ed: 2001, 5th ed: 2008)
* ''All Music Guide to Classical Music: The Definitive Guide to Classical Music'' (2004)
* ''All Music Guide to Country: The Definitive Guide to Country Music'' (1st ed: 1997, 2nd ed: 2003)
* ''All Music Guide to Electronica: The Definitive Guide to Electronic Music'' (2001)
* ''All Music Guide to Hip-hop: The Definitive Guide to Rap & Hip-hop'' (2003)
* ''[[All Music Guide to Jazz|All Music Guide to Jazz: The Definitive Guide to Jazz Music]]''&nbsp; (1st ed: 1994, 2nd ed: 1996, 3rd ed: 1998, 4th ed: 2002)
* ''All Music Guide to Rock: The Definitive Guide to Rock, Pop, and Soul'' (1st ed: 1995, 2nd ed: 1997, 3rd ed: 2002)<ref>{{cite web |last=Toon |first=Jason |url=http://www.riverfronttimes.com/1999-07-21/music/rock-stock/ |title=Rock Stock: A book report on the best tomes to consult before buying tunes |work=[[Riverfront Times]] |date=July 21, 1999 |access-date=March 8, 2015 |archive-date=April 30, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150430144519/http://www.riverfronttimes.com/1999-07-21/music/rock-stock/ |url-status=dead}}</ref>
* ''All Music Guide to Soul: The Definitive Guide to R&B and Soul'' (2003)
* ''[[All Music Guide to the Blues|All Music Guide to the Blues: The Definitive Guide to the Blues]]'' (1st ed: 1996, 2nd ed: 1999, 3rd ed: 2003)
* ''All Music Guide Required Listening: Classic Rock'' (2007)
* ''All Music Guide Required Listening: Contemporary Country'' (2008)
* ''All Music Guide Required Listening: Old School Rap & Hip-hop'' (2008)
* ''All Music Guide to the Music of 2002: Your Guide to the Recordings of the Year'' (2003)
* ''All Music Guide to the Music of 2003: Your Guide to the Recordings of the Year'' (2004)

== Reception ==
In August 2007, ''[[PCMag|PC Magazine]]'' included AllMusic in its "Top 100 Classic Websites" list.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://pcmag.com/slideshow_viewer/0,3253,l=213025&a=212961&po=19,00.asp |title= Top 100 Classic Websites – AllMusic – Slideshow from pcmag.com |date= August 13, 2007 |last= Heater |first= Brian |work= [[PCMag |PCmag.com]] |access-date= September 24, 2013 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20170329235847/http://www.pcmag.com/slideshow_viewer/0%2C3253%2Cl%3D213025%26a%3D212961%26po%3D19%2C00.asp |archive-date= March 29, 2017 |url-status= dead}}</ref><ref name="Wired">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.wired.com/wired/archive/2.02/all.music.html |title=All Music |last=Wolf |first=Gary |date=February 1994 |magazine=[[Wired (magazine) |Wired]] |access-date=February 27, 2014}}</ref>

'''Paul Kevin Jonas II''' (born November 5, 1987) is an American singer-songwriter, guitarist, and actor. He rose to fame as the lead guitarist of the [[pop rock]] band [[Jonas Brothers]] alongside his younger brothers, singer-songwriters [[Joe Jonas|Joe]] and [[Nick Jonas]]. The three brothers became prominent figures on the [[Disney Channel]] alongside his brothers in the late 2000s, gaining a large following through the network: they appeared in the widely successful musical television film, ''[[Camp Rock]]'' (2008) and its sequel, ''[[Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam]]'' (2010) as well as two other series, ''[[Jonas Brothers: Living the Dream]]'' (2008–2010) and ''[[Jonas (TV series)|Jonas]]'' (2009–2010).

After the Jonas Brothers confirmed a hiatus in 2012, Kevin appeared on his own [[E!]] reality series that same year, ''[[Married to Jonas]],'' with his wife, [[Danielle Jonas]]. Following the band's initial break-up in 2013, he appeared on the [[The Apprentice (American season 14)|seventh season]] of ''[[The Celebrity Apprentice]]'' in 2014, founded the construction company Jonas Werner, and became the co-CEO of The Blu Market, an influencer marketing company. In February 2019, the Jonas Brothers reunited and would go on to release their fifth studio album, ''[[Happiness Begins]]'', that summer. The band members appeared in two [[Amazon Prime Video]] documentaries named ''[[Chasing Happiness|Jonas Brothers: Chasing Happiness]]'' and ''[[Happiness Continues: A Jonas Brothers Concert Film|Happiness Continues]]'' in 2019 and 2020, respectively. Kevin appeared on ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine's list of the Sexiest Men Alive in 2008 at the age of 21. He therefore was included as part of its 21 Club.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Kevin Jonas: A Sexy Surprise |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hS78vI-RFw0 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/hS78vI-RFw0 |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live |magazine=People |via=YouTube |access-date=March 11, 2019 |date=December 10, 2008}}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://people.com/archive/the-21-club-vol-70-no-22/|title=The 21 Club|magazine=People|date=December 1, 2008|access-date=March 11, 2019}}</ref> He released his debut solo single, "Changing", in late 2025.

==Early life==
{{Further|Jonas Brothers#Personal lives}}
Paul Kevin Jonas Jr. was born on November 5, 1987, in [[Teaneck, New Jersey]], and grew up in [[Wyckoff, New Jersey|Wyckoff]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2650334/bio|title=Kevin Jonas|website=IMDb|access-date=September 28, 2019}}</ref> His mother, Denise Marie (née Miller), is a former sign language teacher and singer, and his father, Paul Kevin Jonas Sr., is a songwriter, musician, and former ordained minister at an [[Assemblies of God]] church.<ref name=lat>Sean Patrick Reily. [http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/music_blog/2009/02/the-jonas-broth.html "The Jonas Brothers: It's full scream ahead"] ''[[The Los Angeles Times]]''; February 26, 2009</ref><ref>Chebatoris, Jac. [http://www.newsweek.com/boy-band-next-door-87403 "The Boy Band Next Door"] ''[[Newsweek]]''; January 26, 2008|publisher=Allen, Kevin</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1N1-1231F2C01C4DBE28.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150329151258/http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1N1-1231F2C01C4DBE28.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=March 29, 2015|title=Jonas Brothers in overdrive|newspaper=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|access-date=August 25, 2008}}</ref><ref name=elpe>{{cite news|last=Cotliar|first=Sharon|title=Growing Up Jonas|publisher=People Magazine|date=June 25, 2008| url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20204099,00.html|access-date=July 23, 2010}}</ref> He has three younger brothers, [[Joe Jonas|Joe]] (b. 1989), [[Nick Jonas|Nick]] (b. 1992), and [[Frankie Jonas|Franklin]] (b. 2000).<ref name=":0" /> As a child, Jonas appeared in several TV commercials as well as print ads. Unlike his brothers, he originally did not intend to become a musician but became interested one day after stumbling upon a book on playing guitar and playing his father’s guitar.<ref>{{cite book | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DIhmDwAAQBAJ&dq=%C2%A0kevin+jonas+commercial&pg=PA19 | title=Jonas Brothers | isbn=978-1-4205-0236-7 | last1=Mooney | first1=Carla | date=6 November 2009 | publisher=Greenhaven Publishing LLC }}</ref> He attended [[Eastern Christian High School]] in [[North Haledon, New Jersey]].<ref>Hotz, Alexander. [https://www.newspapers.com/article/glen-rock-gazette-profile-of-jonas-broth/137474547/ "Girls visit ''Oprah,'' meet teen idols"], ''Glen Rock Gazette'', May 9, 2008. Accessed December 27, 2023, via [[Newspapers.com]]. "The Jonas Brothers are composed of three brothers: Joe, Nick, and Kevin. They are originally from Wyckoff, and attended Eastern Christian High School in North Haledon."</ref>

==Career==
===2005–2006: Career beginnings===
In early 2005, [[Columbia Records]]' new president, [[Steve Greenberg (record producer)|Steve Greenberg]], listened to [[Nick Jonas|Nick]]'s record. While Greenberg did not like the album, he did like Nick's voice.<ref name="M+C">Mikael Wood (February 20, 2007). [https://web.archive.org/web/20070226090431/http://music.monstersandcritics.com/news/article_1266165.php/Jonas_Brothers_deliver_squeaky_clean_punk_music Jonas Brothers deliver squeaky clean 'punk' music]. MonstersandCritics.com. Accessed 2009-01-01.</ref> After hearing the song "Please Be Mine", written and performed by all the brothers, [[Daylight Records|Daylight]]/Columbia Records decided to sign the three as a group act.<ref name="BCSD">{{cite web|url=http://www.boysoloist.com/artist.asp?VID=317|title=The Boy Choir & Soloist Directory: Nicholas Jonas|access-date=October 24, 2014|archive-date=July 7, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170707225412/https://boysoloist.com/artist.asp?VID=317|url-status=dead}}</ref> After being signed to Columbia, the brothers considered naming their group "Sons of Jonas" before settling on the name "[[Jonas Brothers]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/bands/b/boy_bands/050207/index2.jhtml |title=MTV – The New Boy Bands |website=[[MTV]] |access-date=October 24, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141128092933/http://www.mtv.com/bands/b/boy_bands/050207/index2.jhtml |archive-date=November 28, 2014 }}</ref> [[It's About Time (Jonas Brothers album)|''It's About Time'']], the brothers' first album, was released on August 8, 2006.<ref>[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=jonas brothers|chart=all}} Billboard Discography – Jonas Brothers – It's About Time]</ref> According to the band's manager, it was only a "limited release" of a little over 50,000 copies. Because [[Sony]] was not interested in further promoting the band, the Jonas Brothers then considered switching labels. The band was ultimately dropped by Columbia Records in early 2007.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.insider.com/the-jonas-brothers-career-timeline-2019-3|title=From 'Year 3000' to 'Sucker,' here's how the Jonas Brothers' careers have evolved|last=Cook|first=Meghan|website=Insider|access-date=September 28, 2019}}</ref>

===2007–2012: Breakthrough with the Jonas Brothers===
[[File:Kevin Jonas 2009.jpg|thumb|Jonas performing in 2009]]
[[File:Jonas brothers in 2010.jpg|thumb|Jonas Brothers performing "[[Burnin' Up (Jonas Brothers song)|Burnin' Up]]" in 2010]]
After shortly being without a label, the Jonas Brothers signed with [[Hollywood Records]] in February 2007.<ref>{{cite press release |title=The Jonas Brothers Sign Record Deal With Disney's Hollywood Records |publisher=Hollywood Records |date=February 8, 2007 |url=http://sev.prnewswire.com/entertainment/20070208/LATH11608022007-1.html |access-date=July 16, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070213073434/http://sev.prnewswire.com/entertainment/20070208/LATH11608022007-1.html |archive-date=February 13, 2007}}</ref> Around the same time, the brothers began appearing in [[Gap Inc.]] commercials for [[Baby Bottle Pop]], singing the [[jingle]]. Their self-titled second album, ''[[Jonas Brothers (album)|Jonas Brothers]]'', was released on August 7, 2007.<ref>[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=jonas brothers|chart=all}} Billboard Discography – Jonas Brothers]</ref> It reached number five on the [[Billboard Hot 200|''Billboard'' Hot 200]] chart in its first week.<ref name=":1" /> Jonas and his brothers guest-starred in an episode of ''[[Hannah Montana]]'', titled "[[Me and Mr. Jonas and Mr. Jonas and Mr. Jonas]]", which aired August 17, 2007 on [[Disney Channel]]. The episode debuted alongside the television film ''[[High School Musical 2]]'' and a sneak peek of ''[[Phineas and Ferb]]''.<ref>{{cite web |title=Disney Channel Sets Cable Ratings Records With "High School Musical 2", "Phineas and Ferb" & "Hannah Montana" |url=http://www.nickandmore.com/2007/08/20/disney-channel-sets-cable-ratings-records-with-high-school-musical-2-phineas-and-ferb-hannah-montana/ |website=Nickandmore! |access-date=March 11, 2019 |date=August 20, 2007}}</ref> The episode broke basic cable records with a record 10.7 million viewers and became basic cable's most watched series telecast ever.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Ryan |first1=Joal |title=High School Musical 2 Big 2 B Ignored |url=https://www.eonline.com/news/55958/high-school-musical-2-big-2-b-ignored |website=E! Online |access-date=March 11, 2019 |date=August 18, 2007}}</ref>

Jonas and his brothers also starred in the [[Disney Channel Original Movie]] ''[[Camp Rock]]'', where they played a band called "Connect 3". Kevin played Jason, a guitarist; Nick played Nate, also a guitarist; and Joe played the lead male role and lead singer, Shane Gray.<ref name=":3">{{Citation|title=Camp Rock|url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1055366/|access-date=October 5, 2019}}</ref> A [[Camp Rock (soundtrack)|soundtrack]] for the movie was released on June 17, 2008. The film premiered on June 20, 2008, on Disney Channel in the United States, on Disney Channel, and on [[Family Channel (Canadian TV network)|Family]] in Canada.<ref name=":3" /> They returned in the sequel, ''[[Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam]]'', which premiered on September 3, 2010.<ref>{{Citation|title=Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam|url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1252380/|access-date=October 5, 2019}}</ref> The Disney Channel reality short series, ''[[Jonas Brothers: Living the Dream]]'', premiered on Disney Channel, May 16, 2008.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/jonas-brothers-living-the-dream/episodes-season-1/293750|title=Jonas Brothers: Living the Dream {{!}} TV Guide|website=TVGuide.com|language=en|access-date=October 5, 2019}}</ref> The show, which ran until September 5, 2008, documented the brother's lives during the ''Look Me in the Eyes'' Tour. The name was inspired by their hit song [[When You Look Me in the Eyes]]. The series was renewed for a second season, which premiered March 21, 2010.<ref name=":4" /> The second season followed the band on the European leg of their World Tour 2009. The Jonas Brothers' third studio album, ''[[A Little Bit Longer]]'', was released in the United States on August 12, 2008, and peaked at No. 1 on the ''Billboard'' 200.<ref name="billboard-lbl">{{cite magazine |url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=jonas brothers|chart=all}} |title=Jonas Brothers – A Little Bit Longer |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=August 17, 2008}}</ref>

Kevin, Joe, Nick, and Frankie starred in their own [[Disney Channel Original Series]], ''[[Jonas (TV series)|Jonas]]'', which premiered May 2, 2009.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/article/2009/04/03/jonas-brothers-6/| title=Jonas Brothers's Disney Channel Show: There's got to be a Better Idea| first=Margaret|last=Lyons|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|date=April 3, 2009 |access-date=March 11, 2019}}</ref> The show was renewed for a second season premiering June 20, 2010 as ''Jonas L.A.'' It centered on the brothers vacationing at their summer house in Los Angeles with Stella and Macy. On June 16, 2009, the brothers' fourth studio album, and third release under Hollywood Records, titled ''[[Lines, Vines, and Trying Times]]'' was released. The album peaked at number 1 on the Billboard 200 with 247,000 copies sold.<ref name=":1">{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/jonas-brothers/chart-history/tlp/|title=Jonas Brothers Chart History|magazine=Billboard|access-date=October 5, 2019}}</ref>

Jonas appeared on MTV's fourth episode of ''[[When I Was 17]]'', talking about life as a teenager, regarding sports and his hairstyles.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1639811/bret-michaels-kevin-jonas-katharine-mcphee-open-up-on-when-i-was-17/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191222092438/http://www.mtv.com/news/1639811/bret-michaels-kevin-jonas-katharine-mcphee-open-up-on-when-i-was-17/|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 22, 2019|title=Bret Michaels, Kevin Jonas, Katharine McPhee Open Up On 'When I Was 17'|agency=MTV News|date=May 21, 2010|access-date=October 5, 2019}}</ref> He guest hosted ''[[Live with Kelly]]'', December 13, 2011, and did so a second time on July 4, 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2012/06/20/michael-strahan-kevin-jonas-carrie-ann-inaba-and-mark-feuerstein-to-co-host-live-with-kelly-for-the-week-of-july-2-6-2012-961310/20120620abc02/|title=Breaking News – Michael Strahan, Kevin Jonas, Carrie Ann Inaba & Mark Feuerstein to Co-Host "Live! With Kelly" for the Week of July 2–6, 2012 |website=The Futon Critic|access-date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> It was announced on May 1, 2012, that the Jonas Brothers parted ways with their record label Hollywood Records, and bought the rights to their music.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/46397/jonas-brothers-leave-disneys-hollywood-records|title=Jonas Brothers Leave Disney's Hollywood Records|magazine=Billboard|access-date=October 5, 2019}}</ref>

===2013–2018: Jonas Brothers split===
Kevin appeared in an E! reality series alongside his wife, Danielle, and his brothers, which premiered on August 19, 2012. Produced by [[Ryan Seacrest]], ''[[Married to Jonas]]'' documented the young couple's domestic life as well as the brothers' recording efforts as they prepared to release their fifth studio album.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1684086/kevin-jonas-ryan-seacrest-married-to-jonas/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140511172925/http://www.mtv.com/news/1684086/kevin-jonas-ryan-seacrest-married-to-jonas/|url-status=dead|archive-date=May 11, 2014|title=Kevin Jonas Partners With Ryan Seacrest For 'Married To Jonas'|last=Vena|first=Jocelyn|website=MTV News|language=en|access-date=2019-10-05}}</ref> The final episode of the second season aired on May 26, 2013. On October 29, 2013, The Jonas Brothers officially announced that the band was breaking up because of creative differences.<ref>{{Cite web|last1=Gibson|first1=Kelsie|url=https://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Why-Did-Jonas-Brothers-Break-Up-2013-46167004|title=Why Did the Jonas Brothers Break Up|website=PopSugar|date=7 June 2019 |access-date=October 5, 2019}}</ref>

After parting ways with the Jonas Brothers in 2013, he founded the real estate development, construction company called JonasWerner, and is the co-CEO of The Blu Market company, which deals with communications and plans for social media influencers.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://heavy.com/entertainment/2014/09/kevin-jonas-rhonj-real-housewives-wife-danielle-construction-company-jonaswerner-baby-new-jersey/|title=Kevin Jonas, 'Real Housewives of New Jersey': 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know|work=[[Heavy.com]]|date=September 28, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.inc.com/adam-fridman/does-your-story-need-a-social-influencer-kevin-jonas-believes-it-does.html|title= Does Your Story Need a Social Influencer? Kevin Jonas Believes it Does|work=Inc.com|date=January 25, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fastcompany.com/person/kevin-jonas|title=Most Creative People Kevin Jonas|work=Fast Company|access-date=March 13, 2018}}</ref> Jonas was part of the [[The Apprentice (U.S. season 14)|seventh season]] of ''[[Celebrity Apprentice]]'' taping in spring 2014, which was filmed throughout New York City.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/kevin-jonas-reveals-his-plan-750676|title=Kevin Jonas Reveals His Plan For 'Celebrity Apprentice' Domination|website=The Hollywood Reporter|date=20 November 2014 |language=en|access-date=May 10, 2019}}</ref> He was fired in the second episode when his team lost the competition, during which time he'd been acting as the team leader. Kevin also made a cameo in a 2014 episode of [[The Real Housewives of New Jersey]], working in his new role as contractor, leading the construction on Housewife Kathy Wakile's home.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kevin Jonas is a contractor on 'The Real Housewives of New Jersey'|url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/kevin-jonas-is-a-contractor-on-the-real-housewives-of-new-jersey/|publisher=Fox News|date=September 29, 2014|access-date=September 29, 2014}}</ref>

In 2015, he created the food app Yood.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/kevin-jonas-launches-yood-app-2014-11?IR=T|title=Kevin Jonas Discusses His App Yood And Branching Out Into World Of Tech|work=[[HuffPost]]|date=June 16, 2015}}</ref> As of 2016, he is also in partnership with the video-sharing app [[We Heart It]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/danschawbel/2016/07/28/kevin-jonas-from-a-successful-music-career-to-full-time-entrepreneur/#5c92021530ab|title=Kevin Jonas: From A Successful Music Career To Full-Time Entrepreneur|work=[[Forbes]]|date=July 28, 2016}}</ref>

===2019–present: Jonas Brothers reunion and ''Happiness Begins''===
On February 28, 2019, nearly six years after the Jonas Brothers' initial breakup, the brothers announced the band's reunion.<ref name=":2">{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/jonas-brothers-reunion-new-music-sucker-late-late-show-801382/ |title=Jonas Brothers Confirm Reunion, Plan First New Music in Six Years |last=Reed |first=Ryan |date=February 28, 2019|magazine=Rolling Stone|access-date=2019-10-05}}</ref> They commenced their reunion the next day by releasing a new single, "[[Sucker (song)|Sucker]]" on March 1, 2019, and partaking in a week-long segment on ''[[The Late Late Show with James Corden]]''.<ref name=":2" /> Jonas and his brothers appeared in the band's documentary ''[[Chasing Happiness]]'', which was released on June 4, 2019. On May 9, 2019, a compilation album titled ''[[Music from Chasing Happiness]]'' was released. It consists of old Jonas Brothers songs, two Nick songs, one Joe song featuring a guest appearance from [[Lil Wayne]], and a song from Joe's band [[DNCE]].<ref name=":5">{{Citation|title=Chasing Happiness|url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt9882084/|access-date=2019-10-05}}</ref> Directed by [[John Lloyd Taylor]], the documentary covers the brothers' childhood, how they started as a band, why the band broke up, and how the band got back together.<ref name=":5" />

They released their fifth studio album, ''[[Happiness Begins]]'' on June 7, 2019. It was the band's first album released after their reunion.<ref name=":6">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/3126619/jonas-brothers-happiness-begins-fan-reactions/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190607191945/http://www.mtv.com/news/3126619/jonas-brothers-happiness-begins-fan-reactions/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 7, 2019|title=Jonas Brothers' Comeback Album Happiness Begins Is Here, And Fans Have No Chill|last=Roth|first=Madeline|website=MTV News|language=en|access-date=2019-10-05}}</ref> They have released two songs with other artists: their feature on "[[Runaway (Sebastián Yatra, Daddy Yankee and Natti Natasha song)|Runaway]]" by [[Sebastián Yatra]], [[Daddy Yankee]], and [[Natti Natasha]], as well as their collaboration on "[[Lonely (Diplo song)|Lonely]]" with [[Diplo]]. They released a song titled "Greenlight" for their episode of ''[[Songland]]'' the same day on June 18, three days before "Runaway". On November 8, they released a Christmas song, "[[Like It's Christmas]]".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Curto |first1=Justin |last2=Haylock |first2=Zoe |title=It's the First Week of November, and the Jonas Brothers Have Already Released a Christmas Song |url=https://www.vulture.com/2019/11/jonas-brothers-like-its-christmas.html |access-date=September 3, 2020 |work=Vulture.com |date=November 8, 2019}}</ref> On January 17, 2020, they released the single "[[What a Man Gotta Do]]".<ref>{{Cite web|title=The Jonas Brothers release 'What a Man Gotta Do,' their first single of 2020|url=https://ew.com/music/2020/01/17/the-jonas-brothers-release-what-a-man-gotta-do-first-single-2020/|website=EW.com|language=EN|access-date=2020-05-06}}</ref> Since July 11, 2022, Jonas has been co-hosting the reality competition series ''[[Claim to Fame (TV series)|Claim to Fame]]'' on ABC alongside his brother, [[Frankie Jonas|Franklin Jonas]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Porter |first=Rick |date=2022-03-23 |title=Kevin and Frankie Jonas to Host Celebrity Relative Reality Show for ABC |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/kevin-frankie-jonas-celebrity-relative-reality-show-abc-1235117428/ |access-date=2023-04-28 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |language=en-US}}</ref> 

Jonas starred alongside his brothers in ''[[A Very Jonas Christmas Movie]]'', which was released on [[Disney+]] and [[Hulu]] on November 14, 2025, along with a soundtrack album.<ref name="billboard1">{{cite news |last1=Atkinson |first1=Katie |title=Kevin Jonas Talks ‘Bucket-List’ Jonas Brothers Christmas Movie & (Finally!) Making His Solo Debut With ‘Changing’: ‘I Feel Like I’ve Lived This Song’ |url=https://www.billboard.com/media/podcasts/kevin-jonas-brothers-christmas-solo-debut-pop-shop-podcast-1236122074/ |access-date=2 December 2025 |publisher=Billboard |date=25 November 2025}}</ref> On November 20, 2025, Jonas released his debut solo single, "Changing".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kaufman |first1=Gil |title=Kevin Jonas Finally Announces Release Date For His Debut Solo Single, ‘Changing’ |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/kevin-jonas-release-date-changing-debut-solo-single-1236098455/ |access-date=14 November 2025 |publisher=Billboard |date=27 October 2025}}</ref> It was written by [[Jason Evigan]] and produced by Mark Schick.<ref name="billboard1"/>

==Personal life==
[[File:NewFrontKevin Jonas.jpg|upright=0.85|thumb|Jonas in 2011]]
Kevin Jonas lives in New Jersey with his wife, [[Danielle Jonas]], and their two daughters.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.refinery29.com/en-us/2019/06/234421/danielle-jonas-brothers-kevin-wife-met-story-chasing-happiness|title=Inside Danielle & Kevin Jonas' Love Story|last=Nicolaou|first=Elena|website=www.refinery29.com|date=27 April 2019 |language=en|access-date=2019-10-05}}</ref>

Danielle is a former hairdresser with Ryan Rodgers Redken Ambassador, and the pair married at [[Oheka Castle]] on December 19, 2009, with his brothers Joe and Nick as his best men. The couple met while vacationing with their families in [[the Bahamas]] in May 2007.<ref>{{cite web |last=Cotliar |first=Sharon |title=Kevin Jonas Marries in Fairytale Setting |url=https://people.com/celebrity/kevin-jonas-marries-in-fairytale-setting/ |website=People |access-date=March 11, 2019 |language=en |date=December 19, 2009}}</ref> Their first daughter was born on February 2, 2014,<ref>Peter Gicas (February 2, 2014). [http://www.eonline.com/news/503278/kevin-jonas-and-wife-danielle-welcome-baby-girl Kevin Jonas and Wife Danielle Welcome Baby Girl]. ''E'' news. Accessed 2014-02-02.</ref> and their second daughter was born on October 27, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://people.com/babies/kevin-jonas-danielle-jonas-welcome-daughter-valentina-angelina/?xid=socialflow_facebook_peoplemag|title=Kevin and Danielle Jonas Welcome Daughter Valentina Angelina – See Her First Photo|website=People|access-date=January 20, 2018}}</ref>

In April 2021, Jonas showed support for the NGO ''GiveIndia'' during the worsening situation of the [[COVID-19 pandemic in India]] and urged fans to help donate to the organization to help.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Priyanka Chopra continues to raise money for Covid 19 fundraiser, says it will make a 'huge difference'|url=https://www.pinkvilla.com/entertainment/hollywood/priyanka-chopra-continues-raise-money-covid-19-fundraiser-says-it-will-make-huge-difference-722399|agency=[[Pinkvilla]]|location=[[Mumbai]]|date=3 May 2021|access-date=13 February 2022|archive-date=10 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220310174033/https://www.pinkvilla.com/entertainment/hollywood/priyanka-chopra-continues-raise-money-covid-19-fundraiser-says-it-will-make-huge-difference-722399|url-status=dead}}</ref>

In September 2021, Jonas and his wife Danielle announced the release of a book for children titled ''There's a Rock Concert in My Bedroom'', which chronicles the story of Emma, a girl who is excited about participating in her school's talent show. The Jonases said the initiative was motivated by their daughters.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gillette |first1=Sam |title=Kevin and Danielle Jonas Write Kids' Book Inspired By Their 'Rock Star' Daughters: They 'Uplift Us' |url=https://people.com/parents/kevin-jonas-danielle-jonas-write-kids-book-inspired-by-their-rock-star-daughters/ |access-date=26 September 2021 |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=23 September 2021}}</ref> It was released in April 2022.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Vorrasi-Banis |first1=Lacey |title=Kevin and Danielle Jonas on their new children's book, There's a Rock Concert in My Bedroom {{!}} EW News |url=https://ew.com/books/kevin-and-danielle-jonas-new-childrens-book/ |access-date=24 April 2022 |magazine=Entertainment Weekly |date=28 March 2022}}</ref> In June 2024, Jonas shared that he was diagnosed with skin cancer after discovering a malignant mole on his forehead, in which had a basal cell carcinoma removed from his head.<ref>{{cite web |title=Kevin Jonas Shares Skin Cancer Diagnosis |url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1403476/kevin-jonas-shares-skin-cancer-diagnosis |website=E! Online |access-date=12 June 2024 |date=12 June 2024}}</ref>
