| rev5Score  = {{Rating|1|5}}<ref name="Guardian">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2008/sep/14/popandrock25 |title=Pop review: Jonas Brothers, A Little Bit Longer |author=<!--Not stated--> |date=September 14, 2008 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |access-date=October 19, 2025 }}</ref>
| rev6       = Jesus Freak Hideout
| rev6Score  = {{rating|3.5|5}}<ref name="JFH">{{cite web |url=https://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/cdreviews/ALittleBitLonger.asp? |title=JFH Music Review |last=Leasure |first=Logan |date=August 17, 2008 |website=Jesus Freak Hideout |access-date=October 18, 2025 }}</ref>
| rev7       = ''[[Los Angeles Times]]''
| rev7Score  = {{Rating|2.5|5}}<ref name="LATimes">{{cite news |url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-recordrack12-2008aug12-story.html |title=New CDs: The Jonas Brothers, Inara George |last=Nichols |first=Natalie |date=August 12, 2008 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |access-date=October 18, 2025 }}</ref>
| rev8       = ''[[Rolling Stone]]''
| rev8Score  = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref name="RollingStone1">{{cite magazine |url=http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/jonasbrothers/albums/album/22115892/review/22187330/a_little_bit_longer |title=Album Reviews - Jonas Brothers - A Little Bit Longer |last=Rosen |first=Jody |date=August 21, 2008 |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090506225915/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/jonasbrothers/albums/album/22115892/review/22187330/a_little_bit_longer |archive-date=May 6, 2009 |access-date=October 18, 2025 }}</ref>
| rev9       = [[Slant Magazine]]
| rev9Score  = {{Rating|2.5|5}}<ref name="Slant">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.slantmagazine.com/music/the-jonas-brothers-a-little-bit-longer/ |title=Review: The Jonas Brothers, ''A Little Bit Longer'' |last=Keefe |first=Jonathan |date=August 11, 2008 |magazine=[[Slant Magazine]] |access-date=October 18, 2025 }}</ref>
| rev10      = ''[[Toronto Star]]''
| rev10Score = {{rating|2.5|4}}<ref name="TorontoStar">{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/music/jonas-brothers-a-little-bit-longer/article_0a3274f4-d911-54e4-a3bf-d9eb5b975061.html |title=Jonas Brothers: A Little Bit Longer |last=Rayner |first=Ben |date=August 12, 2008 |newspaper=[[Toronto Star]] |access-date=October 19, 2025 }}</ref>
}}
''A Little Bit Longer'' received generally positive reviews from music critics. At [[Metacritic]], the album received an above average score of 66 out of 100.<ref name="Metacritic" /> In a 4-star review written by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' editor [[Jody Rosen]] he stated, "The boys fantastic third album is steeped in the fuzzed-up guitars, three-part harmonies and cotton-candy choruses of Big Star and Cheap Trick. Power-pop die-hards awaiting the genre's commercial saviors must reckon with the fact that the messiahs have arrived".<ref name="RollingStone1" /> Natalie Nichols of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' wrote, "The third album from the alpha boy band of the moment is certainly of the moment. Jersey-born Jonas siblings Nick (15), Kevin (20), and Joe (18) hit all the right pop notes with such numbers as the romping come-on 'Got Me Going Crazy', the slightly funky 'Burnin' Up' (a very pale imitation of Prince) and the emo-lite of brokenhearted ballad 'Can't Have You'{{-"}}.<ref name="LATimes" />

In a mixed review from the ''[[Toronto Star]]'', [[Ben Rayner]] when speaking about the albums demographic wrote, "Young hearts will melt, elder stomachs will churn", and "[''A Little Bit Longer''] has one uncritical audience in particular in mind and it serves it as well as can be expected".<ref name="TorontoStar" />

==Commercial performance==
''A Little Bit Longer'' debuted at number one on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] selling 525,402 copies in its first week, according to Nielsen SoundScan.<ref>(August 12–19). Jonas Bros. Score Third-Best Debut Week Of '08, Billboard.com, August 20, 2008</ref> The album also debuted at number one on the US ''Billboard'' Comprehensive Albums, Top Digital Albums, Top Internet Albums, and Tastemakers charts.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.joe-jonas.com/x/index.php/2008/08/25/taking-over-billboard-new-pictures/#comments |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081222055307/http://www.joe-jonas.com/x/index.php/2008/08/25/taking-over-billboard-new-pictures/#comments |archive-date=December 22, 2008 |title=Taking over Billboard |publisher=Joe-Jonas.com |access-date=August 18, 2012}}</ref>

In its second week, the album remained at number one on the US ''Billboard'' 200 selling an additional 147,000 copies, making it the band's fastest selling album to date.<ref>Jonathan Cohen, [http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1044342/jonas-brothers-begin-second-week-at-no-1 "Jonas Brothers Begin Second Week At No. 1"], Billboard.com, August 27, 2008.</ref> In its third week, it fell to number four on the chart, selling another 80,000 copies.<ref>Katie Hasty, [http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1044279/slipknot-edges-the-game-atop-billboard-200 "Slipknot Edges The Game Atop Billboard 200"], Billboard.com, September 3, 2008.</ref> On October 17, 2008, the album was certified [[RIAA Certification|platinum]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) for sales of over a million copies in the United States.<ref name=RIAA/> As of March 2015, the album has sold 2,082,000&nbsp;million copies in the United States.<ref name=USsales>{{cite magazine |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/business/6516477/zayn-malik-departure-one-direction-music-sales|title=Why Zayn Malik's Departure From One Direction Won't Hurt Band's Music Sales|last=Peoples|first=Slenn|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]] |date=March 26, 2015|access-date=March 28, 2015}}</ref>

==Exclusive DVDs==
;[[Target Corporation|Target]] Exclusive DVD
The Target edition of ''A Little Bit Longer'' includes a DVD with the following:
*"JB Rules"
*Live videos from the [[Disney Channel Games]] 2008:
** "S.O.S."
** "Burnin' Up"
** "This Is Me" <small>(with [[Demi Lovato]])</small>

;Jonas Brothers official site pre-order bonus DVD
Fans that pre-ordered ''A Little Bit Longer'' online before its release received a DVD with the following:
*Jonas Brothers' special message
*''A Little Bit Longer'' album piece
*"A Little Bit Longer" (acoustic live performance)
*"Lovebug" (acoustic performance)
*Band in a Bus trailer
*Jonas Brothers YouTube videos

;Woolworths (UK) Exclusive DVD
Buyers of the CD had the option to get an exclusive DVD at extra cost, As they did with "Jonas Brothers" & "Camp Rock"
*Jonas Brothers' special message
*''A Little Bit Longer'' album piece
*Band in a Bus trailer
*Jonas Brothers YouTube videos

;UK "FanPack"
Released in the UK, a limited edition Fan pack containing
*Regular version of the album cd
*Girls skinny fit teeshirt
*Tote bag
*Bracelet
*4 Pin Badges
*All contained inside a clear vanity case with Jonas Brothers emblem

;Canadian deluxe edition
The Canadian Deluxe Edition of ''A Little Bit Longer'' includes a DVD with the following:
* [[Live @ Much]]: Jonas Brothers- A [[MuchMusic]] Special Presentation
* ''A Little Bit Longer'' Album Piece
* Band in a Bus Trailer
* Jonas Brothers YouTube videos;
** DJ Danger
** Nick J Show- Anger
** Tai Chi
** Nick J Show- Revenge
** Gibson Surprise Visit
** Look Me in the Eyes Makes History
** Meet the Queen
* Music videos
** "Burnin' Up"
** "Lovebug"

==Personnel==
;Jonas Brothers
* Joe Jonas – vocals
*Kevin Jonas – guitar, mandolin, vocals
*Nick Jonas – guitar, keyboards, vocals
*John Lloyd Taylor – guitar, vocals

;Additional personnel
*John Fields – bass, keyboards, guitar, programming, string arrangement on "Sorry"
*Dorian Crozier – drums, percussion, keyboards, programming
*Stephen Lu – string arrangement, conducting  on "Shelf", "A Little Bit Longer", "Video Girl", "Can't Have You"
*Eric Gorfain – violin
*Daphne Chen – violin
*Leah Katz – viola
*Richard Dodd – cello (The Section Quartet appears courtesy of Decca)
*Big Rob – vocals on "Burnin' Up"
*Meaghan Martin – vocals on "Video Girl"
*Ken Chastain – tambourine on "Video Girl"
